keywords: TEXAS; REPUBLIC OF TEXAS; FRINGE GROUPS AND MOVEMENTS
headline: Texas Standoff Continues; Next Moves Are Uncertain
snippet: As their standoff with a militant separatist group entered its third day, Texas authorities said today that they remained optimistic that a peaceful surrender by the group would be arranged soon.    But with more than 80 people already driven from...
lead_paragraph: As their standoff with a militant separatist group entered its third day, Texas authorities said today that they remained optimistic that a peaceful surrender by the group would be arranged soon. But with more than 80 people already driven from their homes by the situation and with many demanding that the state move immediately to drive the group out of its ramshackle citadel in the West Texas mountains, the state officials were clearly grappling with the questions of when or whether they should move to dislodge the militants, whose number the state estimated at 13 adults and no children.

keywords: UNITED STATES; SOCIAL CONDITIONS AND TRENDS; NINETEEN HUNDRED SIXTIES
headline: Rude Awakenings From 60's Dreams
snippet: The pungent scent of tear gas has been on my mind in recent months, accompanied by memories of droning helicopters, nervous National Guardsmen and the voice of Abbie Hoffman urging that something provocatively rude be done to a particular college...
lead_paragraph: The pungent scent of tear gas has been on my mind in recent months, accompanied by memories of droning helicopters, nervous National Guardsmen and the voice of Abbie Hoffman urging that something provocatively rude be done to a particular college president. The memories seem to arise from some eerie universe in which different laws are in effect. It somehow made sense to sit in the middle of a city street at 3 A.M. and block nonexistent traffic in an act of protest. It made sense to close down a major university and invite 13,000 protesters to eat granola and yogurt in the dining halls. It made sense for many to argue that armed revolution was imminent, that the Constitution was about to be suspended, that we were living in a country that had evolved from a Weimar-style republic into something unspeakable.

keywords: BOULDER (COLO); COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Hundreds Fight Police Near Colorado Campus
snippet: For the second night in succession, hundreds of people threw stones and bricks at the police early today. About a dozen people were hospitalized and several others were jailed.    On Friday night, about 1,500 young people gathered on a street after...
lead_paragraph: For the second night in succession, hundreds of people threw stones and bricks at the police early today. About a dozen people were hospitalized and several others were jailed. On Friday night, about 1,500 young people gathered on a street after firefighters arrived to put out a large bonfire that had apparently been set by students celebrating the end of classes. Their confrontation with the police extended into Saturday morning. Eleven people were arrested, and 20 were injured.

headline: NEWS SUMMARY
snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-15    Zaire Awash in Rumors As Kinshasa Awaits Rebels  The inconclusive end to peace talks between President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire and the rebel leader, Laurent Kabila, left Kinshasa, the capital, rife with rumors and panic....
lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-15 Zaire Awash in Rumors As Kinshasa Awaits Rebels The inconclusive end to peace talks between President Mobutu Sese Seko of Zaire and the rebel leader, Laurent Kabila, left Kinshasa, the capital, rife with rumors and panic. Mr. Kabila said his troops were only 40 miles from the international airport; he offered to guarantee the safety of Mr. Mobutu and his family if the President resigned immediately. A1

keywords: MEXICO CITY (MEX); MEXICO; ARMAMENT, DEFENSE AND MILITARY FORCES; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; POLICE
headline: Mexican Police Protest; 7 Officers Are Injured
snippet: Hundreds of protesting police officers battled today with an antiriot force that used clubs and tear gas. The officers had blocked a major expressway to protest transfers and the rising role of the army in policing Mexico City.    Seven officers were...
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of protesting police officers battled today with an antiriot force that used clubs and tear gas. The officers had blocked a major expressway to protest transfers and the rising role of the army in policing Mexico City. Seven officers were injured, four from the riot squad and three among the protesters, said Gen. Enrique Salgado Cordero, the Mexico City Police Chief. Seventeen protesters were arrested. It was the second day of police turbulence in Mexico City.

keywords: JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ELECTIONS
headline: New Clashes in Indonesia
snippet: Supporters of Indonesia's governing party clashed today with backers of an opposition  party in a second day of election campaign violence in Jakarta.     Witnesses said riot police officers and troops were deployed in the city's southern Kebayoran...
lead_paragraph: Supporters of Indonesia's governing party clashed today with backers of an opposition party in a second day of election campaign violence in Jakarta. Witnesses said riot police officers and troops were deployed in the city's southern Kebayoran Lama area and the central Proklamasi district to quell the violence and keep the two sides apart.

keywords: ARGENTINA; UNEMPLOYMENT AND JOB MARKET; LABOR; REFORM AND REORGANIZATION; PRICES (FARES, FEES AND RATES); DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS; GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES
headline: Unrest Erupts In Argentina Over Austerity
snippet: Driven by discontent over high unemployment and declining living standards, violent protests have erupted in major cities and towns throughout Argentina in recent days. Riot policemen have clashed with tens of thousands of people blocking roads,...
lead_paragraph: Driven by discontent over high unemployment and declining living standards, violent protests have erupted in major cities and towns throughout Argentina in recent days. Riot policemen have clashed with tens of thousands of people blocking roads, bridges and Government buildings. The target of the uprisings is the Government's economic reforms, which have brought stability and high growth rates to a country once plagued by hyperinflation, but which have also produced record unemployment as inefficient state industries were sold off and the number of state employees drastically reduced.

keywords: SUHARTO; JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; LEGISLATURES AND PARLIAMENTS; UNEMPLOYMENT AND JOB MARKET; ELECTION ISSUES; ETHICS; ELECTIONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: Police and Troops Break Up Election Rallies in Indonesia
snippet: The Government displayed its power today, using tear gas, rubber bullets and an overwhelming armed presence on the streets of Jakarta, the capital, to quash attempts by its opponents to hold rallies on the last day of campaigning for next week's...
lead_paragraph: The Government displayed its power today, using tear gas, rubber bullets and an overwhelming armed presence on the streets of Jakarta, the capital, to quash attempts by its opponents to hold rallies on the last day of campaigning for next week's parliamentary election. As black-uniformed marines, riot policemen padded like hockey goalies and 20,000 soldiers in battle gear guarded key neighborhoods, hit-and-run convoys of young men on motorcycles buzzed through the city waving banners and gunning their engines.

keywords: NAIROBI (KENYA); KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ELECTIONS
headline: Kenyan Police Break Up March Backing Reform
snippet: Hundreds of riot police officers charged more than 1,000 demonstrators in Nairobi today, beating them with clubs and firing rubber bullets and tear gas.     The demonstrators, led by opposition politicians, were demanding constitutional reforms...
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of riot police officers charged more than 1,000 demonstrators in Nairobi today, beating them with clubs and firing rubber bullets and tear gas. The demonstrators, led by opposition politicians, were demanding constitutional reforms before elections, which are to be held this year.

keywords: MEMPHIS (TENN); LITTLE ROCK (ARK); FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION; ROBBERIES AND THEFTS; AUTOMOBILES; FIREARMS
headline: F.B.I. SWAT Team Loses Vehicle and Weapons
snippet: A vehicle loaded with guns, ammunition and other crime-fighting gear belonging to the Federal Bureau of Investigation was stolen from a motel parking lot here on Monday night in a crime that threatens to be acutely embarrassing to the agency.    The...
lead_paragraph: A vehicle loaded with guns, ammunition and other crime-fighting gear belonging to the Federal Bureau of Investigation was stolen from a motel parking lot here on Monday night in a crime that threatens to be acutely embarrassing to the agency. The burned shell of the vehicle was found early today in an industrial area of the city, according to John W. Hancock of the bureau's Memphis office. Missing were about a dozen weapons, including M-16 rifles and a shotgun, plus tear-gas equipment, ammunition, bulletproof vests, helmets and shields with agency insignia, Mr. Hancock said.

keywords: MEMPHIS (TENN); FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION; ROBBERIES AND THEFTS; VANS
headline: 3 Men Are In Custody After F.B.I. Van Theft
snippet: Police took three men into custody and seized tear gas canisters, a grenade launcher and ammunition Wednesday from a house just blocks from where a stolen F.B.I. assault team van was found after it had been stolen from a hotel parking lot and set...
lead_paragraph: Police took three men into custody and seized tear gas canisters, a grenade launcher and ammunition Wednesday from a house just blocks from where a stolen F.B.I. assault team van was found after it had been stolen from a hotel parking lot and set afire. The Federal Bureau of Investigation said the three men and two others already under arrest for an unrelated theft were being questioned today.

keywords: SMITH, FRANK; PRISONS AND PRISONERS; ATTICA STATE PRISON (NY); SUITS AND CLAIMS AGAINST GOVERNMENT; GUARDS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TORTURE
headline: Ex-Attica Inmate Wins $4 Million for Reprisals After '71 Uprising
snippet: Twenty-six years after he was beaten and tortured in an orgy of reprisals by guards who had crushed the deadliest prison uprising in the country's history, a former Attica inmate was awarded $4 million in damages yesterday by a Federal court jury in...
lead_paragraph: Twenty-six years after he was beaten and tortured in an orgy of reprisals by guards who had crushed the deadliest prison uprising in the country's history, a former Attica inmate was awarded $4 million in damages yesterday by a Federal court jury in Buffalo. The plaintiff, Frank Smith, was forced to walk over broken glass, beaten with batons, locked in his cell for four days, burned with cigarettes, made to lie on a picnic table for hours with a football under his chin and threatened with castration and death. He was the first of 1,281 inmates to win damages in the long-running case. They filed a $2.8 billion civil liability suit in 1974.

keywords: ARAP MOI, DANIEL; KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; CONSTITUTIONS; ELECTIONS; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS
headline: Kenyan President Is Facing a Growing Chorus of Discontent
snippet: With opposition leaders threatening more violent protests like the one that rocked this capital recently, a protracted battle over constitutional reform is looming in Kenya, threatening to overshadow or even derail presidential elections later this...
lead_paragraph: With opposition leaders threatening more violent protests like the one that rocked this capital recently, a protracted battle over constitutional reform is looming in Kenya, threatening to overshadow or even derail presidential elections later this year. Eight months ago, President Daniel arap Moi's political position appeared unassailable. Opposition leaders were splintered along ethnic lines, unable to find a single candidate to challenge the man who has ruled Kenya for 19 years. With his political enemies divided, it looked as if the President would win re-election easily.

keywords: ARAP MOI, DANIEL; SANE, PIERRE; KENYA; AMNESTY INTERNATIONAL; REFORM AND REORGANIZATION; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; ELECTIONS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: Rights Group Urges Kenya to Widen Freedoms Before Election
snippet: The human rights organization Amnesty International said today that Kenya's general elections this year would not be fair unless constitutional reforms were carried out and repressive public-order laws were repealed.     Ending a two-week...
lead_paragraph: The human rights organization Amnesty International said today that Kenya's general elections this year would not be fair unless constitutional reforms were carried out and repressive public-order laws were repealed. Ending a two-week fact-finding visit to this East African nation, Pierre Sane, the secretary general of the group, gave a bleak account of human rights in Kenya.

keywords: WACO: THE RULES OF ENGAGEMENT (MOVIE); MOTION PICTURES; REVIEWS
headline: Indicting The Feds For the Siege At Waco
snippet: An atmosphere of stomach-clenching dread suffuses William Gazecki's grim documentary film, ''Waco: The Rules of Engagement.'' This methodical indictment of the United States Government's siege of the Branch Davidian compound near Waco, Tex., four...
lead_paragraph: An atmosphere of stomach-clenching dread suffuses William Gazecki's grim documentary film, ''Waco: The Rules of Engagement.'' This methodical indictment of the United States Government's siege of the Branch Davidian compound near Waco, Tex., four years ago has awful lessons to teach about governmental hubris and how a deliberate failure to communicate can have catastrophic consequences. That siege left 4 Federal agents and 76 members of the Branch Davidian sect dead. Most of those who perished were incinerated in a fire that destroyed the Mount Carmel compound on April 19, 1993. Among the film's most unsettling images are lingering close-ups of the charred bodies of women and children who died in the inferno.

keywords: ISRAEL; GAZA STRIP; PALESTINIANS
headline: Gaza Arabs and Israelis Clash in Land Dispute
snippet: Israeli soldiers and settlers clashed with  Palestinian crowds in the Gaza Strip today in violence set off by a dispute over land near a Jewish settlement.    The Israeli Army moved two tanks into position near one scene of unrest, which erupted as...
lead_paragraph: Israeli soldiers and settlers clashed with Palestinian crowds in the Gaza Strip today in violence set off by a dispute over land near a Jewish settlement. The Israeli Army moved two tanks into position near one scene of unrest, which erupted as an Egyptian envoy met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Tel Aviv in an effort to restart Israeli-Palestinian negotiations.

keywords: ISRAEL; PRAYERS AND PRAYER BOOKS; JEWS; WOMEN; HOLIDAYS AND SPECIAL OCCASIONS
headline: Orthodox Israelis Assault Jews Praying at Western Wall
snippet: Conservative Jewish men and women who tried to pray together at the Western Wall during the Shavuot holiday early Wednesday morning said today that they had been assaulted by hundreds of rigorously Orthodox men evidently incensed by the sight of...
lead_paragraph: Conservative Jewish men and women who tried to pray together at the Western Wall during the Shavuot holiday early Wednesday morning said today that they had been assaulted by hundreds of rigorously Orthodox men evidently incensed by the sight of women praying with men. The Conservatives said the strictly Orthodox Jews, known more commonly as the haredim, had spat on them and pelted them with garbage and feces, while calling them ''Nazis,'' ''Christians,'' ''whores'' and ''goyim.''

keywords: HANEGBI, TZAHI; NETANYAHU, BENJAMIN; RUBINSTEIN, ELYAKIM; ISRAEL; JEWS; PALESTINIANS; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT
headline: High Court Backs Netanyahu in Influence-Peddling Case
snippet: The Israeli Supreme Court today upheld the decision of the Attorney General not to prosecute Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu or his Justice Minister in an influence-peddling case, thus lifting one burden from the embattled Government.    But the...
lead_paragraph: The Israeli Supreme Court today upheld the decision of the Attorney General not to prosecute Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu or his Justice Minister in an influence-peddling case, thus lifting one burden from the embattled Government. But the threat of a major confrontation with American Jews over rules for conversion to Judaism, the increasingly tense impasse in the Palestinian talks and a new rebellion within his coalition have compelled Mr. Netanyahu to cancel a planned trip to the United States.

keywords: NEW YORK STATE; GREAT MEADOW CORRECTIONAL FACILITY; AUBURN CORRECTIONAL FACILITY; ORLEANS CORRECTIONAL FACILITY; PRISONS AND PRISONERS; GUARDS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Guards and Inmates Hurt At Three State Prisons
snippet: Incidents of violence led to the injuries of guards and inmates at three state prisons last week, the State Department of Correctional Services said.    Several inmates were hurt at Great Meadow Correctional Facility in Comstock, after a fight broke...
lead_paragraph: Incidents of violence led to the injuries of guards and inmates at three state prisons last week, the State Department of Correctional Services said. Several inmates were hurt at Great Meadow Correctional Facility in Comstock, after a fight broke out among about 40 inmates. Guards fired a warning shot and dispensed tear gas. At Auburn Correctional Facility on Thursday, a tower officer fired a warning shot to disperse a group of inmates that had surrounded and threatened two correction officers and a sergeant in a recreational yard. The sergeant and a correction officer were hurt.

headline: NEWS SUMMARY
snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-7    Election Results in Mexico Usher in Pluralist Era  Voters in Mexico dealt a blow to single-party rule, as official election results showed that the governing Institutional Revolutionary Party had failed to win an absolute...
lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-7 Election Results in Mexico Usher in Pluralist Era Voters in Mexico dealt a blow to single-party rule, as official election results showed that the governing Institutional Revolutionary Party had failed to win an absolute majority in the national Congress for the first time since its founding in 1929. A1 Cuahtemoc Cardenas lost his first presidential bid in an apparently fraudulent election in 1988. Mr. Cardenas, the leader of the leftist Party of the Democratic Revolution, has now become mayor of North America's largest city. A6

keywords: MOI, DANIEL ARAP; KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; CONSTITUTIONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: Crackdown Bleeds Kenya's Democracy Movement, Killing 7
snippet: Wielding ax handles, tear gas and rubber bullets, riot policemen crushed pro-democracy rallies across Kenya today, killing at least seven people and wounding dozens of others in the worst political violence in this relatively stable country since...
lead_paragraph: Wielding ax handles, tear gas and rubber bullets, riot policemen crushed pro-democracy rallies across Kenya today, killing at least seven people and wounding dozens of others in the worst political violence in this relatively stable country since 1991. The widespread protests and riots were a major embarrassment to President Daniel arap Moi, the authoritarian leader who has ruled Kenya for 19 years and has begrudged every move toward a more democratic system.

keywords: KENYA; UNIVERSITY OF NAIROBI; JOMO KENYATTA UNIVERSITY; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TEAR GAS
headline: Kenya Closes Campuses in Face of Violent Protests
snippet: Fierce clashes broke out at the University of Nairobi today as hundreds of students protested a violent Government crackdown on opposition leaders seeking constitutional reforms.    Witnesses said riot policemen  broke down doors and used tear gas to...
lead_paragraph: Fierce clashes broke out at the University of Nairobi today as hundreds of students protested a violent Government crackdown on opposition leaders seeking constitutional reforms. Witnesses said riot policemen broke down doors and used tear gas to force students out of their dormitories on the main campus in downtown Nairobi this morning. Some students were clubbed as they struggled to pack and flee, they said. At least 20 people were reported hurt.

keywords: BLANCO, MIGUEL ANGEL; PAMPLONA (SPAIN); SPAIN; ASSASSINATIONS AND ATTEMPTED ASSASSINATIONS; BASQUES; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; KIDNAPPING; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TERRORISM
headline: Protests Follow Death of Official Kidnapped by Basque Rebels
snippet: The death early today of a town councilman who had been kidnapped and fatally wounded by Basque separatists touched off new protests against terrorism throughout Spain, with tension rising particularly in the Basque city of Pamplona, where riot...
lead_paragraph: The death early today of a town councilman who had been kidnapped and fatally wounded by Basque separatists touched off new protests against terrorism throughout Spain, with tension rising particularly in the Basque city of Pamplona, where riot policemen struggled to control the angry crowds. The councilman, Miguel Angel Blanco, 29, was kidnapped on Thursday and found shot with two bullets to the head on Saturday near the city of San Sebastian in northern Spain. He died there before dawn today, in the hospital of Our Lady of Aranzazu.

keywords: ISRAEL; HEBRON (WEST BANK); PALESTINIANS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: New Israeli Barriers Fail to Stop Street Clashes in Hebron
snippet: Despite new Israeli concrete barriers along the battle-scarred Shalala Street in Hebron, rock-throwing Palestinian youths again dueled with Israeli soldiers there today, and four television crewmen shot by the soldiers were among the wounded.   ...
lead_paragraph: Despite new Israeli concrete barriers along the battle-scarred Shalala Street in Hebron, rock-throwing Palestinian youths again dueled with Israeli soldiers there today, and four television crewmen shot by the soldiers were among the wounded. After weeks of the daily clashes along the narrow street, which is divided between the Israeli-controlled security zone and the Palestinian-controlled area, Israel appeared increasingly determined to toughen its stance.

keywords: MOHAWK CORRECTIONAL FACILITY; PRISONS AND PRISONERS; GUARDS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Prison Disturbance Is Quelled in Rome
snippet: Five guards were injured yesterday during a disturbance at the Mohawk Correctional Facility, a correction official said.    The incident began around 6:30 P.M. near a dormitory when a fight broke out between inmates, and a correction lieutenant was...
lead_paragraph: Five guards were injured yesterday during a disturbance at the Mohawk Correctional Facility, a correction official said. The incident began around 6:30 P.M. near a dormitory when a fight broke out between inmates, and a correction lieutenant was hit in the head with a baseball bat, said a correction spokesman, Jim Flateau. Four other guards were injured while breaking up the fight, although Mr. Flateau said none of the injuries were life-threatening. The guards were not immediately identified.

keywords: VERSACE, GIANNI; CUNANAN, ANDREW PHILLIP; MIAMI BEACH (FLA); FLORIDA; MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; SERIAL MURDERS
headline: Body on Boat Could Be Cunanan's, Officials Say
snippet: A police search of a houseboat here on Wednesday revealed the body of a man that local and Federal officials say might be that of Andrew P. Cunanan, the 27-year-old California man suspected in the murders of five men in four states, including Gianni...
lead_paragraph: A police search of a houseboat here on Wednesday revealed the body of a man that local and Federal officials say might be that of Andrew P. Cunanan, the 27-year-old California man suspected in the murders of five men in four states, including Gianni Versace, the fashion designer. Early this morning, Chief Richard Barreto of the Miami Beach Police Department said forensic units had not yet determined the identity of the body. But he said there was a ''similarity in the victim found'' to Mr. Cunanan, the subject of an intensive nationwide manhunt. He added that investigators had found ''nothing else to indicate'' a definite identification. He declined to say how the victim died or whether a weapon was found.

keywords: VALDES, MICHAEL; ADAMS, DARREN; STONE, EMMITT G; NEW YORK CITY; FAR ROCKAWAY (NYC); MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS
headline: Man Slain in Queens After Breaking Up Fight, Police Say
snippet: An act of valor on a subway platform led to the death of a Queens teen-ager Tuesday night when he was tracked down by more than a dozen youths and shot in the chest, the police said.    The victim, Michael Valdes, 19, was shot in a playground at the...
lead_paragraph: An act of valor on a subway platform led to the death of a Queens teen-ager Tuesday night when he was tracked down by more than a dozen youths and shot in the chest, the police said. The victim, Michael Valdes, 19, was shot in a playground at the Hammel Houses on Rockaway Beach Boulevard in Far Rockaway, apparently because he and a cousin had intervened earlier in an argument between a youth and a group of girls on the subway platform, Deputy Inspector Michael Collins, a police spokesman, said.

keywords: VERSACE, GIANNI; CUNANAN, ANDREW; REINECK, TORSTEN; MIAMI BEACH (FLA); MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: At End of Cunanan Manhunt, Suicide and Mystery
snippet: In the desperate days before he shot himself in the master bedroom of a luxury houseboat moored in a canal here, Andrew P. Cunanan telephoned an acquaintance frantically trying to get a fake passport so he could escape, Federal investigators said...
lead_paragraph: In the desperate days before he shot himself in the master bedroom of a luxury houseboat moored in a canal here, Andrew P. Cunanan telephoned an acquaintance frantically trying to get a fake passport so he could escape, Federal investigators said today. ''He was a desperate person with very little room to move about,'' the Miami Beach Police Chief, Richard Barreto, said at a news conference today. ''I'm happy that this has been brought to closure without another victim.''

keywords: VERSACE, GIANNI; CUNANAN, ANDREW PHILLIP; MIAMI BEACH (FLA); MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; SUICIDES AND SUICIDE ATTEMPTS
headline: In the End, Cunanan Proved Neither Cunning Nor Brazen
snippet: A broken lock lay on the floor of the houseboat, a sign the intruder had forced his way inside. Pillows and blankets were scattered about, and a makeshift bed sat in the living room. The intruder had moved from boat to boat along the dock, rarely...
lead_paragraph: A broken lock lay on the floor of the houseboat, a sign the intruder had forced his way inside. Pillows and blankets were scattered about, and a makeshift bed sat in the living room. The intruder had moved from boat to boat along the dock, rarely venturing elsewhere, not even for food. His corpse, when the authorities found it, looked a bit scrawny, they said, not much like the robust man from the wanted posters. In the end, the most wanted fugitive in America, Andrew P. Cunanan, a 27-year-old man the authorities once labeled brazen, wily and highly intelligent, had holed up along the edge of the water for nine days, officials said, too frightened to cape. Rather than face an unscripted ending, he shot himself in the mouth with a .40 caliber gun.

keywords: ISRAEL; PALESTINIANS
headline: Palestinians Say Israelis Plan Raids
snippet: In a new sign of the breakdown in trust between peace partners, top Palestinian officials warned today that Israel might be preparing to stage commando operations in territory under Palestinian control.    With Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader,...
lead_paragraph: In a new sign of the breakdown in trust between peace partners, top Palestinian officials warned today that Israel might be preparing to stage commando operations in territory under Palestinian control. With Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader, still defying Israeli demands that he carry out a security crackdown against Islamic militants, the Palestinians said they had information suggesting that Israel could soon make good on threats to make such raids.

keywords: CHILUBA, FREDERICK; KUANDA, KENNETH D; ZAMBIA; ASSASSINATIONS AND ATTEMPTED ASSASSINATIONS; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT
headline: Kaunda, Wounded, Sees Official Plot to Kill Him
snippet: Former President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia said today that he had been warned that the Government wanted to assassinate him before he was shot and wounded by the police at an opposition rally on Saturday.    Mr. Kaunda, a critic of President...
lead_paragraph: Former President Kenneth D. Kaunda of Zambia said today that he had been warned that the Government wanted to assassinate him before he was shot and wounded by the police at an opposition rally on Saturday. Mr. Kaunda, a critic of President Frederick Chiluba, was grazed on the forehead by a bullet as policemen fired on his car after they moved in to break up a rally of the National Opposition Alliance in the central town of Kabwe, north of this capital.

keywords: LOTEM, YUVAL; ISRAEL; PALESTINIANS; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Lonely Israeli Fights Israel's Treatment of Arabs
snippet: Yuval Lotem, a lieutenant in the Israeli Army reserve, vividly remembers the scene when he reported to the Megiddo jail: two young Palestinian prisoners taking out the garbage, ringed by military police officers and a platoon of reservists carrying...
lead_paragraph: Yuval Lotem, a lieutenant in the Israeli Army reserve, vividly remembers the scene when he reported to the Megiddo jail: two young Palestinian prisoners taking out the garbage, ringed by military police officers and a platoon of reservists carrying tear-gas canisters, helmets and clubs. ''When I saw that, I sensed how right I was when I refused to be a part of it,'' Mr. Lotem said of his refusal to serve at the military prison to protest the detention of Palestinians there without trial. ''If they've done something wrong, why aren't they being tried?''

keywords: ALBRIGHT, MADELEINE K; ARAFAT, YASIR; WEST BANK; BETHLEHEM (WEST BANK); ISRAEL; GAZA STRIP; PALESTINE LIBERATION ORGANIZATION; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; PALESTINIANS; ISRAEL-INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS-US; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Israeli Closing of Bethlehem Brings Tensions to a Boil
snippet: Black smoke billowed from burning tires and the crack of rubber bullets echoed through the streets of Bethlehem today as dozens of Palestinian youths hurled stones at Israeli soldiers to protest Israel's military closing of the town, which has now...
lead_paragraph: Black smoke billowed from burning tires and the crack of rubber bullets echoed through the streets of Bethlehem today as dozens of Palestinian youths hurled stones at Israeli soldiers to protest Israel's military closing of the town, which has now lasted nearly a month. The clashes reflected rising frustration among Palestinians at Israeli sanctions imposed after the suicide bombing in Jerusalem last month.

keywords: WEST BANK; BETHLEHEM (WEST BANK); ISRAEL; JERUSALEM; PALESTINIANS; BOMBS AND EXPLOSIVES; TERRORISM
headline: To Ease Crisis, Israel Lifts Bar To Bethlehem
snippet: Israel  announced an end to a four-week military blockade of the West Bank city of Bethlehem today, removing a small but important irritant in the Israeli-Palestinian partnership.    The announcement followed several days of ugly clashes in Bethlehem...
lead_paragraph: Israel announced an end to a four-week military blockade of the West Bank city of Bethlehem today, removing a small but important irritant in the Israeli-Palestinian partnership. The announcement followed several days of ugly clashes in Bethlehem between Israeli forces and Palestinian youths, including one that proved to be a significant embarrassment to Israel, when Palestinian schoolgirls had to be evacuated on Tuesday after Israeli soldiers mistakenly fired tear gas into their schoolyard.

keywords: PLAVSIC, BILJANA; KARADZIC, RADOVAN; BRCKO (BOSNIA); BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA; NORTH ATLANTIC TREATY ORGANIZATION; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: 2 G.I.'s Are Hurt Confronting Pro-Karadzic Bosnian Serbs
snippet: Hundreds of angry Serbs armed with stones, metal bars and firebombs today confronted American peacekeeping troops who were seeking to wrest control of the town's police station from forces loyal to Radovan Karadzic, the wartime Bosnian Serb leader.  ...
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of angry Serbs armed with stones, metal bars and firebombs today confronted American peacekeeping troops who were seeking to wrest control of the town's police station from forces loyal to Radovan Karadzic, the wartime Bosnian Serb leader. The NATO peacekeeping troops fired warning shots and tear-gas grenades to disperse the crowds and later repelled a mob that had besieged 40 international police officers in their headquarters. Two G.I.'s were slightly hurt, apparently by rocks.

keywords: PLAVSIC, BILJANA; KARADZIC, RADOVAN; BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA; NORTH ATLANTIC TREATY ORGANIZATION; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE
headline: NATO at Crossroads in Bosnia: Serb Power Struggle Is Seen as 'Defining Moment'
snippet: Earlier this month, NATO intelligence learned that the police in the Bosnian Serb city of Banja Luka who remain loyal to their wartime leader, Radovan Karadzic, had stored large numbers of weapons in preparation for a coup attempt against his...
lead_paragraph: Earlier this month, NATO intelligence learned that the police in the Bosnian Serb city of Banja Luka who remain loyal to their wartime leader, Radovan Karadzic, had stored large numbers of weapons in preparation for a coup attempt against his successor, Biljana Plavsic, the Bosnian Serb President. The NATO-led forces moved immediately to foil the putsch and protect Ms. Plavsic.

keywords: OHIO; MANSFIELD CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTION; PRISONS AND PRISONERS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Disturbance Is Quelled At Ohio Death-Row Unit
snippet: The Mansfield Correctional Institution, 60 miles northeast of Columbus, was back under control early this morning after tactical teams quelled an uprising by inmates at a death-row housing unit.    Thirty-seven inmates gathered in a common area of...
lead_paragraph: The Mansfield Correctional Institution, 60 miles northeast of Columbus, was back under control early this morning after tactical teams quelled an uprising by inmates at a death-row housing unit. Thirty-seven inmates gathered in a common area of one of the prison's four death-row pods after some inmates overpowered three guards around 5 P.M. on Friday and released the other inmates from their cells, said Andrea Dean, a spokeswoman for the state Department of Rehabilitation and Correction.

keywords: COMORO ISLANDS; ANJOUAN; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; INDEPENDENCE MOVEMENTS AND SECESSION
headline: Indian Ocean Islands Racked by Secession
snippet: The Government has begun withdrawing troops from Anjouan, one of the four Comoro islands, apparently ending its effort to put down a separatist uprising there after meeting heavy resistance.     The Government troops were dispatched to the island on...
lead_paragraph: The Government has begun withdrawing troops from Anjouan, one of the four Comoro islands, apparently ending its effort to put down a separatist uprising there after meeting heavy resistance. The Government troops were dispatched to the island on Wednesday, Pierre Yere, of the Organization of African Unity, said on Friday. He said the fighting was very heavy, but neither he nor the Government provided any casualty toll.

keywords: KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; CONSTITUTIONS; ELECTIONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: 5 Lawmakers Held as Kenya Blocks a Rally
snippet: The police detained opposition legislators today, fired tear gas and closed an open-air market to prevent a rally calling for legal and constitutional reforms before elections this year.     Five opposition lawmakers, all from the Forum for...
lead_paragraph: The police detained opposition legislators today, fired tear gas and closed an open-air market to prevent a rally calling for legal and constitutional reforms before elections this year. Five opposition lawmakers, all from the Forum for Restoration of Democracy-Kenya, were detained at the local airport and barred from attending the demonstration, which a police spokesman called illegal.

keywords: CLINTON, BILL; RENO, JANET; GORE, AL; UNITED STATES; JUSTICE DEPARTMENT; FINANCES; ETHICS; ELECTIONS; PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION OF 1996
headline: Unhurried, Reno Ponders the Proper Course in a Political Storm
snippet: Attorney General Janet Reno's aides have become accustomed to her laborious style of decision-making. After numbing hours of meetings, she retreats to her fifth-floor Justice Department inner sanctum -- a cozy corner office with a soft couch and easy...
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Janet Reno's aides have become accustomed to her laborious style of decision-making. After numbing hours of meetings, she retreats to her fifth-floor Justice Department inner sanctum -- a cozy corner office with a soft couch and easy chairs, a cheery stone fireplace (where Bobby Kennedy once grilled hamburgers) and bullet-resistant windows installed during a scare over Colombian hit men. ''She just goes in there and burrows in,'' said a lawyer who has watched the intellectual ritual in the past. It is a process Ms. Reno is about to undertake again as time runs out on making a decision to seek an independent counsel to investigate telephone fund-raising by President Clinton and Vice President Al Gore. ''She reads and reads and reads, calls people up, asks hard questions, has all kinds of fits,'' the lawyer said. ''Sometimes she can be a royal pain.''

keywords: COMOROS ISLANDS; ANJOUAN; FRANCE; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; INDEPENDENCE MOVEMENTS AND SECESSION
headline: Mutsamudu Journal; Indian Ocean Island Yearns to Retie Colonial Bond
snippet: The French flag can be seen these days all over the tiny island of Anjouan, flying high above this almost deserted port, fluttering over the market where citizens have so little cash that most exchanges are in barter, and peeping from the shutters...
lead_paragraph: The French flag can be seen these days all over the tiny island of Anjouan, flying high above this almost deserted port, fluttering over the market where citizens have so little cash that most exchanges are in barter, and peeping from the shutters and rooftops of crumbling stucco homes. Not long ago, the green-and-white crescent moon and stars of the Comoros hung on these flagpoles.

keywords: CLINTON, BILL; RENO, JANET; UNITED STATES; JUSTICE DEPARTMENT; SPECIAL PROSECUTORS (INDEPENDENT COUNSEL); FINANCES; ETHICS; ELECTIONS; PRESIDENTIAL ELECTION OF 1996
headline: Reno Confronts Republicans On Demands for Prosecutor
snippet: Attorney General Janet Reno withstood eight hours of often antagonistic questioning today by Republican lawmakers, rebuffing their assault by saying that she had not uncovered enough evidence to step aside to let an independent prosecutor pursue...
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Janet Reno withstood eight hours of often antagonistic questioning today by Republican lawmakers, rebuffing their assault by saying that she had not uncovered enough evidence to step aside to let an independent prosecutor pursue Democratic campaign finance abuses. At varying times, in her appearance before the House Judiciary Committee, Ms. Reno seemed combative, stoic and conciliatory as she steadfastly refused to explain the details of the Justice Department's investigation into some aspects of the re-election efforts for President Clinton. But she tried to assure highly skeptical Republicans of her ability to conduct the inquiry impartially.

keywords: KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: Police With Whips Halt Rally in Kenya
snippet: The police broke up a pro-democracy rally here today with whips, clubs and tear gas, sending thousands of panicked demonstrators running.    The violence was the latest in a series of clashes between the police and protesters calling for...
lead_paragraph: The police broke up a pro-democracy rally here today with whips, clubs and tear gas, sending thousands of panicked demonstrators running. The violence was the latest in a series of clashes between the police and protesters calling for constitutional and electoral reforms from President Daniel arap Moi.

keywords: MOI, DANIEL ARAP; KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; ELECTIONS
headline: Kenyan Leader Warns Opposition on Vote
snippet: Kenya's President warned today that he would take swift action against ''anyone who dares to interfere'' with an election he hopes will extend his 19-year rule.    His troops used tear gas and clubs today to break up the latest anti-Government...
lead_paragraph: Kenya's President warned today that he would take swift action against ''anyone who dares to interfere'' with an election he hopes will extend his 19-year rule. His troops used tear gas and clubs today to break up the latest anti-Government protest, in Nyeri, 60 miles north of the Kenyan capital. Hundreds of demonstrators turned out on Kenyatta Day, a holiday named after the country's first President, the late Jomo Kenyatta.

keywords: SANTO DOMINGO (DOMINICAN REPUBLIC); DOMINICAN REPUBLIC; LOOT AND LOOTING; ELECTRIC LIGHT AND POWER; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TEAR GAS
headline: Dominicans Protest Power Cuts in Capital
snippet: Demonstrators looted shops, threw stones and burned tires in the suburbs of Santo Domingo early today in protest against continued power cuts. The police fired tear gas and shotguns to disperse them.     The protests began on Monday in about five...
lead_paragraph: Demonstrators looted shops, threw stones and burned tires in the suburbs of Santo Domingo early today in protest against continued power cuts. The police fired tear gas and shotguns to disperse them. The protests began on Monday in about five districts where residents have borne the brunt of the cuts, lasting up to 20 hours each day. Residents also said they were angry about the rising cost of living.

keywords: ALLEN, SHIRLEY ANN; ILLINOIS; FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION; ROBY; MENTAL HEALTH AND DISORDERS
headline: One-Woman Standoff at 'Roby Ridge'
snippet: Shirley Ann Allen peers occasionally through the back window of her green farmhouse. The camouflaged state troopers, hiding in her woods for more than a month now, hope she cannot see them. If she steps onto her deck for even a few seconds, without...
lead_paragraph: Shirley Ann Allen peers occasionally through the back window of her green farmhouse. The camouflaged state troopers, hiding in her woods for more than a month now, hope she cannot see them. If she steps onto her deck for even a few seconds, without her shotgun, they plan to take her away for a court-ordered psychiatric exam. The Illinois State Police have tried every means short of an assault to draw out Mrs. Allen, a 51-year-old widow and former nurse whose family says she is mentally ill and dangerous. The police shut off her electricity and heat, disabled her water pump and cut off her telephone. They fired tear gas, hit her with beanbag bullets, and played Barry Manilow music. Then they pulled back and tried three weeks of the silent treatment. She responded with silence.

keywords: GUEVARA, ERNESTO; UGAV, YOSEFA; BRODMAN, BARBARA; LATIN AMERICA; CUBA; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Hot on the Trail Of Che Guevara
snippet: THIS year marks the 30th anniversary of the death of the Argentine-born revolutionary leader Che Guevara. At least three biographies of Guevara have been published recently, formal commemorative ceremonies took place last month in Bolivia, and...
lead_paragraph: THIS year marks the 30th anniversary of the death of the Argentine-born revolutionary leader Che Guevara. At least three biographies of Guevara have been published recently, formal commemorative ceremonies took place last month in Bolivia, and informal remembrances were going on elsewhere in South America.

snippet: The police, using truncheons and tear gas, prevented two opposition rallies in Algiers today, after the Government warned that it would no longer tolerate street protests against local election results,    On Sunday, the Algerian Interior Ministry...
lead_paragraph: The police, using truncheons and tear gas, prevented two opposition rallies in Algiers today, after the Government warned that it would no longer tolerate street protests against local election results, On Sunday, the Algerian Interior Ministry warned political leaders to call a halt to their protests against last month's local election results.

keywords: JAWARISH, ALI; BETHLEHEM (WEST BANK); ISRAEL; PALESTINIANS; CHILDREN AND YOUTH; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Arab Youths Vent Anger Over Shooting
snippet: Violent protests erupted here today after the funeral of a Palestinian boy shot by an Israeli soldier, even as the boy's organs were transplanted in Israel in keeping with his family's wishes.     The boy, 8-year-old Ali Jawarish, died on Saturday in...
lead_paragraph: Violent protests erupted here today after the funeral of a Palestinian boy shot by an Israeli soldier, even as the boy's organs were transplanted in Israel in keeping with his family's wishes. The boy, 8-year-old Ali Jawarish, died on Saturday in an Israeli hospital, four days after he was shot in the head by a soldier breaking up a stone-throwing demonstration near the Jewish shrine of Rachel's Tomb, an Israeli enclave in Palestinian-ruled Bethlehem.

keywords: KHATAMI, MOHAMMED; IRAN; INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; ISLAM; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; CHURCH-STATE RELATIONS
headline: Iran's New Policies Face Conservative Backlash
snippet: A series of increasingly violent confrontations that have shaken Iran in recent weeks reflect growing tension between forces wanting to liberalize Iranian society and others who want to keep it strictly conservative, diplomats and political analysts...
lead_paragraph: A series of increasingly violent confrontations that have shaken Iran in recent weeks reflect growing tension between forces wanting to liberalize Iranian society and others who want to keep it strictly conservative, diplomats and political analysts say. The tension reached a peak on Wednesday, when the police used tear gas to disperse a crowd that attacked and ransacked a religious school in the holy city of Qum, 75 miles south of Teheran. The crowd was angry that the school's director had called for curbs on the country's supreme religious leader, Ayatollah Ali Khameni, who has power over elected officials.

headline: NEWS SUMMARY
snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-6    Russia Presses U.N. To Ease Sanctions on Iraq  Russia asked the governing board of the United Nations commission in charge of disarming Iraq to declare Baghdad free of nuclear weapons and near compliance on prohibited...
lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-6 Russia Presses U.N. To Ease Sanctions on Iraq Russia asked the governing board of the United Nations commission in charge of disarming Iraq to declare Baghdad free of nuclear weapons and near compliance on prohibited missiles, as a first step to easing sanctions. A1

snippet: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, today assailed dissidents who have questioned his authority and said they would be prosecuted to the full extent of the law.     But he called on Iranians to stop demonstrating against the most prominent...
lead_paragraph: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, today assailed dissidents who have questioned his authority and said they would be prosecuted to the full extent of the law. But he called on Iranians to stop demonstrating against the most prominent dissident, Ayatollah Hossein Ali Montazeri.

headline: Dozens Hurt in Bethlehem Clash Over Prisoners
snippet: The worst single day of Israeli-Palestinian clashes in months left nearly 40 people injured today.    In Bethlehem, Palestinian demonstrators and Israeli troops fought from noon until dusk with rubber bullets, tear gas and stones near the Jewish...
lead_paragraph: The worst single day of Israeli-Palestinian clashes in months left nearly 40 people injured today. In Bethlehem, Palestinian demonstrators and Israeli troops fought from noon until dusk with rubber bullets, tear gas and stones near the Jewish shrine of Rachel's Tomb.

keywords: KABILA, LAURENT; CONGO (FORMERLY ZAIRE); TRAVEL RESTRICTIONS; POLITICAL PRISONERS; FREEDOM OF THE PRESS; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; FREEDOM OF SPEECH; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS; NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA
headline: Congo's Opposition Pays Price of Defying Kabila
snippet: When Arthur Z'Ahidi Ngoma decided last week to test the waters in the new Congo to see just how much space there was for opposition politicians, the answer he got was as swift as it was brutal.    On the second day of a political forum organized by...
lead_paragraph: When Arthur Z'Ahidi Ngoma decided last week to test the waters in the new Congo to see just how much space there was for opposition politicians, the answer he got was as swift as it was brutal. On the second day of a political forum organized by Mr. Ngoma, a former United Nations official and leader of a small political group called the Forces of the Future, Congolese security forces cordoned off the area around the downtown hotel where the event was being held.

keywords: ZIMBABWE; TAXATION; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; VETERANS

snippet: Zimbabwe canceled a tax to benefit veterans today, hours after the police used tear gas and clubs to stop a workers' demonstration against the tax.     But the Government left intact other components of a tax package, which has brought fierce...
lead_paragraph: Zimbabwe canceled a tax to benefit veterans today, hours after the police used tear gas and clubs to stop a workers' demonstration against the tax. But the Government left intact other components of a tax package, which has brought fierce opposition across the country.

keywords: MONTAZERI, HUSSEIN ALI; KHAMENEI, ALI; IRAN; TREASON; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Iranian Clerics Hint at Treason Trial for a Critic
snippet: Clerical authorities are hinting that they intend to press treason charges against a prominent theologian who challenged the credentials of Iran's religious leadership, signaling that they will not yield any of their power despite the hopes raised...
lead_paragraph: Clerical authorities are hinting that they intend to press treason charges against a prominent theologian who challenged the credentials of Iran's religious leadership, signaling that they will not yield any of their power despite the hopes raised last spring when a moderate was elected President. Ayatollah Ali Montazeri, a prominent theologian in this holy city, issued the challenge by questioning the credentials of an old rival who now leads the religious establishment.

keywords: JAGAN, JANET; JAGAN, CHEDDI; GUYANA; FRAUDS AND SWINDLING; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ELECTIONS; ELECTION RESULTS
headline: Election Protest in Guyana
snippet: Riot police officers fired shotguns and tear gas today to disperse hundreds of demonstrators who said election fraud helped an American expatriate to take a strong lead in the presidential vote on Monday.    Opposition leaders said they would seek a...
lead_paragraph: Riot police officers fired shotguns and tear gas today to disperse hundreds of demonstrators who said election fraud helped an American expatriate to take a strong lead in the presidential vote on Monday. Opposition leaders said they would seek a court injunction to challenge the results.

keywords: JAGAN, JANET; HOYTE, DESMOND; GUYANA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; ELECTIONS
headline: Loser Vows to Press Fight on Guyana Vote Result
snippet: The losing candidate in Guyana's presidential election says that he will fight what he called the rigged election of an American expatriate and charges that her quick swearing-in was a violation of the Constitution.    The candidate, Desmond Hoyte,...
lead_paragraph: The losing candidate in Guyana's presidential election says that he will fight what he called the rigged election of an American expatriate and charges that her quick swearing-in was a violation of the Constitution. The candidate, Desmond Hoyte, contended on Saturday that the elections commission chairman, Doodnauth Singh, had violated the Constitution by declaring Janet Jagan the winner while votes were still being counted and without consulting other commission members. Mrs. Jagan is the widow of the popular former President, Cheddi Jagan.

keywords: MOI, DANIEL ARAP; KENYA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ELECTIONS
headline: Pre-Vote Melee in Kenya
snippet: The police fired tear gas today to break up a skirmish in western Kenya between supporters of President Daniel arap Moi and their opponents.     The disturbance, in Homa Bay, began after Mr. Moi, speaking before a crowd of about 1,000, welcomed the...
lead_paragraph: The police fired tear gas today to break up a skirmish in western Kenya between supporters of President Daniel arap Moi and their opponents. The disturbance, in Homa Bay, began after Mr. Moi, speaking before a crowd of about 1,000, welcomed the defection to his party of two of the candidates for Parliament. The elections Monday include a vote for President; Mr. Moi, who has been in office for 19 years, is favored.

keywords: ITALY; EUROPE; EUROPEAN UNION; FINES (PENALTIES); FARMERS; CROP CONTROLS AND SUBSIDIES; PRICES (FARES, FEES AND RATES); DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; DAIRY PRODUCTS; MILK
headline: Dairy Farmers Must Finance Their Subsidy, Italy Insists
snippet: They are called ''milk fines,'' and for more than a decade these penalties have been paid by Italian governments to the European Union to allow Rome to subsidize Italy's unprofitable dairy industry. The payments have become a symbol of Italy's...
lead_paragraph: They are called ''milk fines,'' and for more than a decade these penalties have been paid by Italian governments to the European Union to allow Rome to subsidize Italy's unprofitable dairy industry. The payments have become a symbol of Italy's insistence on maintaining costly farm production and jobs at consumers' expense. But this week more than 450 farmers across Italy blocked roads with tractors to protest a Government plan to shift the cost to the farmers. ''This game of the milk fines has to be ended,'' said Vilmare Giacomazzi, an organizer of demonstrations held today in Rome. An invasion of Rome by thousands of tractors is planned for Sunday.

keywords: ACTEAL (MEX); CHIAPAS (MEX); CHENALHO (MEXICO); MEXICO; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: Mexico Accuses Policeman Of Helping Arm Mass Killers
snippet: Federal prosecutors have accused a state police commander of helping to arm a gang of paramilitary gunmen who killed 45 Indian villagers in December. They are the first criminal charges filed against police and state government officials who have...
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have accused a state police commander of helping to arm a gang of paramilitary gunmen who killed 45 Indian villagers in December. They are the first criminal charges filed against police and state government officials who have been under investigation for the massacre. Federal prosecutors indicated that their investigation was closing in on higher state officials who may have provided direct support to the killers. They said the police commander had testified that ''superior officers'' ordered him to turn a blind eye to paramilitary groups flaunting illegal weapons in his precinct as long as they were sympathizers of the governing Institutional Revolutionary Party, or PRI.

keywords: PATAKI, GEORGE E; POWERS, WILLIAM D; D'AMATO, ALFONSE M; MCCAUGHEY ROSS, BETSY; NEW YORK STATE; REPUBLICAN COMMITTEE; FINANCES; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: A Political Kingmaker Takes No Prisoners; Steely State Chairman, a Former Marine, Has the State G.O.P. Squared Away
snippet: To those who like or despise him, but particularly to the many who fear him, the essential thing about New York's Republican state chairman, William D. Powers, is this: He was a Marine Corps sergeant, and loved it.    In his Albany office, a bumper...
lead_paragraph: To those who like or despise him, but particularly to the many who fear him, the essential thing about New York's Republican state chairman, William D. Powers, is this: He was a Marine Corps sergeant, and loved it. In his Albany office, a bumper sticker that reads, ''What part of Marine do you not understand?'' is plastered over Lieut. Gov. Betsy McCaughey Ross's name on a plaque certifying her 1994 election. (Mr. Powers helped engineer her removal from Gov. George E. Pataki's 1998 ticket.) Behind his desk hangs a red-and-gold Marine Corps flag. And in a closet back home on his 100-acre Columbia County farm hangs his crisply pressed Marine Corps uniform, waiting for the next Memorial Day parade.

keywords: KING, MARTIN LUTHER JR; MEMPHIS (TENN); KU KLUX KLAN; HOLIDAYS AND SPECIAL OCCASIONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: A City Strives to Balance Its Role in King Legacy
snippet: In the decades since the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was slain here, this city has struggled to live down the impact of that moment on its national image and in the hearts of its residents.     A hotly contested appearance by the Ku Klux Klan on...
lead_paragraph: In the decades since the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was slain here, this city has struggled to live down the impact of that moment on its national image and in the hearts of its residents. A hotly contested appearance by the Ku Klux Klan on Saturday did nothing to lessen that struggle, even as the city began a three-month celebration of Dr. King's legacy.

headline: NEWS SUMMARY
snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-9    Cuban and Papal Officials Maneuver on Coming Visit  Days before the arrival of Pope John Paul II, Vatican and Cuban officials are locked in behind-the-scenes maneuvering that could determine the visit's political impact....
lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-9 Cuban and Papal Officials Maneuver on Coming Visit Days before the arrival of Pope John Paul II, Vatican and Cuban officials are locked in behind-the-scenes maneuvering that could determine the visit's political impact. Fidel Castro, the Cuban leader, has used the state-run media to portray the Pope as an ally against American imperialism. The Church, meanwhile, has been negotiating to gain greater access to the island's media to make its case itself. A1 Pope Names 22 New Cardinals Francis Eugene George, the Archbishop of Chicago, was one of 22 new cardinals named by Pope John Paul II, and one of 2 Americans. The other American was James Francis Stafford, the Archbishop Emeritus of Denver. This Pope has now named 106 out of the current 123 cardinals, who will choose future popes from among their ranks. A8

lead_paragraph: Denver Broncos fans poured into the streets to celebrate their team's Super Bowl victory tonight. Sgt. Dennis Cribari of the Denver police said several people had been arrested for fighting or creating a disturbance. He estimated about 10,000 people rallied downtown.

keywords: SRI LANKA; BOMBS AND EXPLOSIVES; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TERRORISM; BUDDHISM
headline: 11 Killed in Truck Bombing At Sri Lanka Buddhist Site
snippet: Three suicide bombers crashed a truck through the gates of Sri Lanka's holiest Buddhist temple here early today and blew themselves up, killing 8 other people, wounding 23 and setting off ethnic riots.    The nation, which is mainly Buddhist, was...
lead_paragraph: Three suicide bombers crashed a truck through the gates of Sri Lanka's holiest Buddhist temple here early today and blew themselves up, killing 8 other people, wounding 23 and setting off ethnic riots. The nation, which is mainly Buddhist, was stunned as word spread of the attack on the Temple of the Tooth, where a tooth that the faithful believe belonged to Buddha is kept. The Government reassured an enraged public today that the tooth had not been harmed.

keywords: DENVER (COLO); DENVER BRONCOS; GREEN BAY PACKERS; SUPER BOWL; FOOTBALL
headline: Denver's Dot on Map Swells in the Afterglow
snippet: Cow town no more, Denver today was the Broncos' town.    A stylized stallion with its flame-orange mane reigned over the city as residents savored their first Super Bowl victory, a civic boost after 20 years of humiliations, including four losses in...
lead_paragraph: Cow town no more, Denver today was the Broncos' town. A stylized stallion with its flame-orange mane reigned over the city as residents savored their first Super Bowl victory, a civic boost after 20 years of humiliations, including four losses in National Football League championship games.

keywords: DONS, STEVEN DOUGLAS; WAIBEL, COLLEEN; PORTLAND (ORE); ATTACKS ON POLICE; MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; FIREARMS
headline: National News Briefs; Patrol Officer Is Killed In Arms Raid on Home
snippet: A patrol officer was shot to death on Tuesday and two vice officers were wounded as they raided a home that neighbors said was stocked with high-powered weapons.    After a two-and-a-half-hour standoff, the police fired tear gas into the house,...
lead_paragraph: A patrol officer was shot to death on Tuesday and two vice officers were wounded as they raided a home that neighbors said was stocked with high-powered weapons. After a two-and-a-half-hour standoff, the police fired tear gas into the house, knocked down the wounded suspect, Steven Douglas Dons, with a beanbag gun and drove him away on the tailgate of an armored van.

keywords: ALBRIGHT, MADELEINE K; NETANYAHU, BENJAMIN; ISRAEL; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; PALESTINIANS; ISRAEL-INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS-US
headline: Israelis Worry That Peace Effort Is Dead
snippet: In the view of leading Israeli commentators, Secretary of State Madeleine K. Albright's failure to budge Israeli and Palestinian leaders from their impasse over the weekend marked the end of the current American mediating effort -- and a low point in...
lead_paragraph: In the view of leading Israeli commentators, Secretary of State Madeleine K. Albright's failure to budge Israeli and Palestinian leaders from their impasse over the weekend marked the end of the current American mediating effort -- and a low point in relations between Ms. Albright and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. At her meetings with Mr. Netanyahu and the Palestinian leader, Yasir Arafat, Ms. Albright told each in effect that she was sick and tired of their inability to make tough decisions, and she left with virtually all major differences still unresolved.

keywords: HOFFA, JAMES JR; HOFFA, JAMES R; CAREY, RON; INTERNATIONAL BROTHERHOOD OF TEAMSTERS; APPOINTMENTS AND EXECUTIVE CHANGES; FINANCES; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Jimmy Hoffa's Revenge
snippet: On a wind-whipped fall day, a creaking, leaking motor home angles into the parking lot of the V.F.W. hall in Brick Township, N.J., and releases into a knot of waiting teamsters the scion and heir-presumptive of the most notorious labor leader in...
lead_paragraph: On a wind-whipped fall day, a creaking, leaking motor home angles into the parking lot of the V.F.W. hall in Brick Township, N.J., and releases into a knot of waiting teamsters the scion and heir-presumptive of the most notorious labor leader in American history. ''Welcome to Brick, Jimmy!'' shouts a barrel-bellied man, and James Phillip Hoffa shouts back, ''Thanks, buddy!'' and then the cluster of teamsters moves inside the hall, and Jimmy smiles wide, and a wave of applause washes over him. The applause is for his father too, the martyred father who, the mythology says, had this great union stolen from him by the Kennedys, and who had his life stolen from him by the Mob, and whose son is going to redeem this union in his name. Smoke gets in Jimmy's eyes as he inches his way inside, where the air is damp and smells of cigarillos and Wal-Mart cologne and steam tables that keep the hot dogs hot. The teamsters wear black T-shirts and hooded sweatshirts that scream ''Hoffa'' like a threat, and these 45-year-old white men who drive trucks in the dead of winter and break their backs on loading docks while their bosses plot to hijack all the good jobs to Mexico, they buy up the sweatshirts at Hoffa rallies just like the black teen-agers who bought ''X'' caps to proclaim their to-hell-with-you militancy. These are freight guys, mainly, drivers and warehousemen, not ''Buster Browns,'' the shorts-wearing package boys -- teamsters in brown shorts, can you believe it? -- from the U.P.S. wing of the union, which is Ron Carey's wing.

keywords: IRAQ; PALESTINIANS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Palestinians Hold March in Bethlehem to Show Support for Iraq
snippet: Several hundred Palestinians marched in support of Iraq today, but without the popular support that accompanied the Persian Gulf war of 1991.    Carrying Iraqi flags and chanting, ''With blood and soul we sacrifice for you, Iraq,'' the demonstrators...
lead_paragraph: Several hundred Palestinians marched in support of Iraq today, but without the popular support that accompanied the Persian Gulf war of 1991. Carrying Iraqi flags and chanting, ''With blood and soul we sacrifice for you, Iraq,'' the demonstrators marched the length of the main commercial road through Bethlehem. At one intersection, they paused to burn an American flag.

keywords: EGYPT; IBRAHIMIYA (EGYPT); AGRICULTURE; RENTING AND LEASING; LAND USE POLICIES
headline: Egyptian Farmer Is Slain
snippet: A villager was killed and 12 other people, most of them police officers, were injured today when the police tried to oust a tenant farmer in northern Egypt in accordance with the country's new land law, police officials said.    Under the law owners...
lead_paragraph: A villager was killed and 12 other people, most of them police officers, were injured today when the police tried to oust a tenant farmer in northern Egypt in accordance with the country's new land law, police officials said. Under the law owners can end rental contracts and force tenants to pay higher rents or leave the land.

keywords: RIBICOFF, ABRAHAM A; CONNECTICUT; CONGRESS; CABINETS AND SUB-CABINETS; UNITED STATES POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Ribicoff of Connecticut Dies; Governor and Senator Was 87
section: Front Page; Washington; Obituaries; New York and Region
snippet: Abraham A. Ribicoff, the powerful and popular Governor of Connecticut, Congressman and United States Senator who served as Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare under John F. Kennedy, the President he helped elect, died yesterday at the Hebrew...
lead_paragraph: Abraham A. Ribicoff, the powerful and popular Governor of Connecticut, Congressman and United States Senator who served as Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare under John F. Kennedy, the President he helped elect, died yesterday at the Hebrew Home for the Aged at Riverdale in the Bronx. He was 87 and had homes in Manhattan and Cornwall Bridge, Conn. Mr. Ribicoff, who spent nearly half a century in public service before retiring in 1981, had Alzheimer's disease and had been at the Riverdale home for several weeks. His wife, Lois, who is known as Casey, said that the cause of death was heart failure. Funeral services are scheduled for Wednesday at 11 A.M. at Temple Emanu-El on Fifth Avenue at 65th Street in Manhattan.

keywords: JONES, GAYL; BLACKS; BOOKS AND LITERATURE; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; MENTAL HEALTH AND DISORDERS; SUICIDES AND SUICIDE ATTEMPTS
headline: Author's Downward Spin Rivals Tragedies in Her Novels of Black America
snippet: In the late 1970's, before Gayl Jones all but vanished from a literary world that had applauded her novels about black America as pioneering, even brilliant, she wrote powerfully about the legacy of slavery, of racism, rape, incest and abuse, of...
lead_paragraph: In the late 1970's, before Gayl Jones all but vanished from a literary world that had applauded her novels about black America as pioneering, even brilliant, she wrote powerfully about the legacy of slavery, of racism, rape, incest and abuse, of violence between women and men, and other things hot to the touch. People who knew her then described her as quiet, private, confident, a woman who wrote not about issues that had scarred her own life, but about the things that interested her. She wrote about reality, say writers who knew her and her work, but not necessarily her own.

keywords: KOSOVO (SERBIA); SERBIA; KOSOVO LIBERATION ARMY; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; INDEPENDENCE MOVEMENTS AND SECESSION; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE; MINORITIES (ETHNIC, RACIAL, RELIGIOUS); DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Serbia's Police Crush Protest By Kosovo's Ethnic Albanians
snippet: The Serbian police used truncheons, water cannon and tear gas today to  disperse some 30,000 ethnic Albanians who were marching to protest  the killing over the weekend of more than 20 civilians by paramilitaries.    Serious unrest in Kosovo...
lead_paragraph: The Serbian police used truncheons, water cannon and tear gas today to disperse some 30,000 ethnic Albanians who were marching to protest the killing over the weekend of more than 20 civilians by paramilitaries. Serious unrest in Kosovo Province, where 90 percent of the people are ethnic Albanians, erupted on Friday when four policemen were killed in an ambush by rebels from the Kosovo Liberation Army.

keywords: MELOUK, FARID; BELGIUM; ALGERIA; FRANCE; BOMBS AND EXPLOSIVES; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE
headline: World News Briefs; Belgians Arrest Suspect In Paris Bombings
snippet: Belgian special forces today stormed the hideout of a suspected Islamic militant believed to have been involved in bombings in Paris, ending a siege that lasted 12 hours.     The police said they used tear gas to smoke out the man, tentatively...
lead_paragraph: Belgian special forces today stormed the hideout of a suspected Islamic militant believed to have been involved in bombings in Paris, ending a siege that lasted 12 hours. The police said they used tear gas to smoke out the man, tentatively identified as Farid Melouk, who they said had been on the run since 1995. He was sentenced in his absence last month by a Paris court to seven years in jail for providing logistical support for the Armed Islamic Group.

keywords: SAN JERONIMO TULIJA (MEXICO); CHIAPAS (MEXICO); MEXICO; INDIANS, AMERICAN
headline: Mexico's Overtures to the Zapatistas Bring Tensions in Chiapas to a New Boiling Point
snippet: The soldiers arrived in a column of armored vehicles intending to bring the Government's peace to a valley where many Indian farmers support the Zapatista rebels. But instead of peace, the troops who camped in a school soccer field five days ago...
lead_paragraph: The soldiers arrived in a column of armored vehicles intending to bring the Government's peace to a valley where many Indian farmers support the Zapatista rebels. But instead of peace, the troops who camped in a school soccer field five days ago brought the hamlet to the brink of bloodshed. A thousand fist-waving Zapatista villagers formed a phalanx along the field, yelling insults and demanding that the soldiers leave. As an army helicopter buzzed low overhead, a smaller band of pro-Government villagers stood by up the road, ready to charge the Zapatistas if they should attack the army.

keywords: JASHARI, ADEM; KOSOVO (SERBIA); SERBIA; PREKAZ (SERBIA); KOSOVO LIBERATION ARMY; INDEPENDENCE MOVEMENTS AND SECESSION; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE
headline: On a Garage Floor in Kosovo, A Gruesome Serbian Harvest
snippet: The bodies of 51 ethnic Albanians, their lower torsos wrapped in white sheets, lay stretched out in two rows on the cement floor of an old garage today as a steady drizzle pelted the tiled roof.    The bodies, a few burned beyond recognition,...
lead_paragraph: The bodies of 51 ethnic Albanians, their lower torsos wrapped in white sheets, lay stretched out in two rows on the cement floor of an old garage today as a steady drizzle pelted the tiled roof. The bodies, a few burned beyond recognition, included 25 women and small children. Most bore the small, dark red holes of bullet wounds. The skulls of some of them were shattered, and one was decapitated.

snippet: A group of Jewish militants marched into a Palestinian-controlled area of Hebron tonight, touching off a melee in which 12 Palestinians, including several journalists, were wounded.    The latest incident occurred on the fourth day of clashes between...
lead_paragraph: A group of Jewish militants marched into a Palestinian-controlled area of Hebron tonight, touching off a melee in which 12 Palestinians, including several journalists, were wounded. The latest incident occurred on the fourth day of clashes between stone-throwing Palestinians and Israeli soldiers, set off by the shooting of three Palestinians at an Israeli Army roadblock on Tuesday.

keywords: INDONESIA; INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND; FINANCES; CREDIT; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS
headline: Indonesia-I.M.F. Talks Show Flexibility on Ending Impasse
snippet: Indonesian officials began meetings today with officials of the International Monetary Fund, with both sides offering signals of flexibility on the deadlock that has caused a halt in disbursements of international aid.    The officials sat down in...
lead_paragraph: Indonesian officials began meetings today with officials of the International Monetary Fund, with both sides offering signals of flexibility on the deadlock that has caused a halt in disbursements of international aid. The officials sat down in five working groups to tackle separate aspects of the economic crisis, including Indonesia's huge burden of corporate debt, a problem the I.M.F. had not previously addressed.

lead_paragraph: A man suspected in a 1993 murder case committed suicide in a sheriff's station bathroom after a nine-hour standoff. The suspect, Jimmie Ray Beagle, 40, was given permission to go to the bathroom. When an officer checked on Mr. Beagle, he saw him aiming a .357-caliber Magnum at his forehead. The officer shut the door.

keywords: SOLO (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: World News Briefs; Indonesian Students Clash With Police
snippet: Rock-throwing students fought with the police and troops today in the most violent clash so far in a monthlong series of anti-Government protests on Indonesian campuses.    Security forces shot tear gas into the crowd and used sticks and clubs to...
lead_paragraph: Rock-throwing students fought with the police and troops today in the most violent clash so far in a monthlong series of anti-Government protests on Indonesian campuses. Security forces shot tear gas into the crowd and used sticks and clubs to beat back about 1,000 students who tried to stage an illegal street march in Solo, 250 miles east of Jakarta, witnesses said.

keywords: MUELLER, NANCY; MUELLER, WILLIAM; KEHOE, CHEVIE; LEE, DANIEL; POWELL, SARAH ELIZABETH; FRINGE GROUPS AND MOVEMENTS; ROBBERIES AND THEFTS; MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; RACKETEERING AND RACKETEERS; KIDNAPPING
headline: Killings Illuminate Culture of White Supremacists
snippet: When William Mueller, his wife and her little girl vanished from their home in the wooded Ozark mountains of northwest Arkansas, his mother-in-law feared that they had gone underground with one of the white separatist groups that Mr. Mueller admired....
lead_paragraph: When William Mueller, his wife and her little girl vanished from their home in the wooded Ozark mountains of northwest Arkansas, his mother-in-law feared that they had gone underground with one of the white separatist groups that Mr. Mueller admired. But the truth was worse. In June 1996, six months after the family disappeared, a man fishing near a lonely, windswept bridge over the Illinois Bayou near Russellville, 38 miles southwest of the family's home in Tilly, sighted a leg floating in the water.

keywords: SUHARTO; INDONESIA; INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND; OIL (PETROLEUM) AND GASOLINE; ELECTRIC LIGHT AND POWER; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; FOOD
headline: Indonesia to Sign 3d I.M.F. Rescue Pact
snippet: Indonesia is within days of signing its third accord in five months with the International Monetary Fund to try to rescue its collapsing economy, and the fund's leadership is already fending off criticism that it is giving in too much to the demands...
lead_paragraph: Indonesia is within days of signing its third accord in five months with the International Monetary Fund to try to rescue its collapsing economy, and the fund's leadership is already fending off criticism that it is giving in too much to the demands of President Suharto, the country's authoritarian leader. The new accord greatly delays the imposition of earlier requirements that Indonesia end its subsidies on electricity, gasoline and a number of basic food items, according to American and fund officials familiar with its details. Indonesian officials insist that the fund's attempt to terminate those subsidies quickly, part of a January economic plan that has never been carried out, are stoking anti-Government protests that have broken out across the country.

keywords: UNITED STATES MILITARY ACADEMY; COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES
