snippet: They were looking forward to the handshake that would make them half-human again. For months the plebes had been counting down the time to their Recognition handshake on Recognition Day.    ''It's huge,'' said Mike Burgwald, a first-year cadet. ''I...
lead_paragraph: They were looking forward to the handshake that would make them half-human again. For months the plebes had been counting down the time to their Recognition handshake on Recognition Day. ''It's huge,'' said Mike Burgwald, a first-year cadet. ''I can't wait to be able to talk on the way to class.''

keywords: SUDAN; ACCIDENTS AND SAFETY; BOATS AND BOATING
headline: 55 Die as Sudan Boat Tips
snippet: A boat accident last week on the Blue Nile in the Sudan killed at least 55 young military conscripts, and hundreds more are missing, the Khartoum daily Alwan reported today.     Alwan said the boat tipped over after recruits crowded on board in an...
lead_paragraph: A boat accident last week on the Blue Nile in the Sudan killed at least 55 young military conscripts, and hundreds more are missing, the Khartoum daily Alwan reported today. Alwan said the boat tipped over after recruits crowded on board in an attempt to escape from a camp used to train soldiers to fight rebels in southern Sudan.

keywords: ESTERMANN, ALOIS; SWISS GUARDS; ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH
headline: Rome Journal; Pope's Little Army Scrambles to Recruit a Chief
snippet: Wanted: Swiss gentleman with military experience to lead the world's smallest army. Must be 5 feet 9 or over and Roman Catholic. Should be noble.    The Swiss Guards, the colorfully dressed soldiers who have defended the Pope and the Vatican gates...
lead_paragraph: Wanted: Swiss gentleman with military experience to lead the world's smallest army. Must be 5 feet 9 or over and Roman Catholic. Should be noble. The Swiss Guards, the colorfully dressed soldiers who have defended the Pope and the Vatican gates since the 16th century, are in want of a leader. And the search for a suitable commander, which has dragged on for five months, has become a baffling mystery inside the Vatican and beyond.

keywords: KORESH, DAVID; WACO (TEX); BRANCH DAVIDIANS; FIRES AND FIREMEN; RELIGIOUS CULTS; MUSEUMS
headline: 5 Years After Waco Standoff, The Spirit of Koresh Lingers
snippet: As the wind kicked up on the prairie and a dull yellow sun dropped in the evening sky, Kimberly Martin handed a bouquet of wild primrose to her mother and scampered over to the rubble of Mount Carmel, the place where she was born nine years ago and...
lead_paragraph: As the wind kicked up on the prairie and a dull yellow sun dropped in the evening sky, Kimberly Martin handed a bouquet of wild primrose to her mother and scampered over to the rubble of Mount Carmel, the place where she was born nine years ago and where, she dimly recalls, David Koresh used to ''teach, teach, teach'' for hours on end. ''I love to come out here and play,'' said Kimberly, a third grader whose father, all three of her sisters and one brother were among the 80 people who died in the fire that consumed Mount Carmel, the Branch Davidian compound, on April 19, 1993. ''I like to climb and just run around.''

keywords: JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Indonesian Police Hold 40 Young Protesters
snippet: The police detained about 40 university students during an anti-Government protest today in Jakarta, local journalists reported.     The students were taken into custody when the police blocked about 500 demonstrators from enlarging their protest...
lead_paragraph: The police detained about 40 university students during an anti-Government protest today in Jakarta, local journalists reported. The students were taken into custody when the police blocked about 500 demonstrators from enlarging their protest beyond the campus of the Ibnu Chaldun University in East Jakarta.

headline: The Nation: Do as We Say, Not as We Do; U.S. Executions Draw Scorn from Abroad
snippet: THERE was hate in the air when protesters gathered in front of the United States embassy in Tegucigalpa on Wednesday. Honduran police armed with riot shields, clubs, tear gas and dogs were assigned to protect the building.    ''The police have...
lead_paragraph: THERE was hate in the air when protesters gathered in front of the United States embassy in Tegucigalpa on Wednesday. Honduran police armed with riot shields, clubs, tear gas and dogs were assigned to protect the building. ''The police have noticed widespread ill feeling,'' Capt. Hector Mejia said. ''We fear there will be aggression toward the embassy or personnel.''

keywords: SUHARTO; INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; PRICES (FARES, FEES AND RATES); ETHICS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS
headline: People Power' Unrest on Indonesian Campuses
snippet: Sitting cross-legged on the floor of the student headquarters at the leading university here, Pandu Gunawan fairly oozed confidence as he spoke of how he and other students are trying to unseat President Suharto, Asia's longest-serving leader.   ...
lead_paragraph: Sitting cross-legged on the floor of the student headquarters at the leading university here, Pandu Gunawan fairly oozed confidence as he spoke of how he and other students are trying to unseat President Suharto, Asia's longest-serving leader. ''We will continue the struggle, whatever the Government does, even if that means we die!'' declared Mr. Gunawan, 22, a student movement leader here in Surabaya, Indonesia's largest city after the capital, Jakarta.

keywords: SUHARTO; INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS
headline: World News Briefs; No Political Reform Till 2003, Suharto Says
snippet: With student violence escalating and the economy in a shambles, President Suharto brushed aside demands for political reform today. That, he said, must wait until his term ends in 2003.    Mr. Suharto, who turns 77 next month, also issued a stern...
lead_paragraph: With student violence escalating and the economy in a shambles, President Suharto brushed aside demands for political reform today. That, he said, must wait until his term ends in 2003. Mr. Suharto, who turns 77 next month, also issued a stern warning to confrontational student protesters who are clamoring daily for an end to his authoritarian rule.

keywords: JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TEAR GAS
headline: Indonesian Police Use Tear Gas on Students
snippet: Police fired tear gas at rock-throwing students on four Jakarta campuses today as tens of thousands of protesters held anti-Government rallies at universities nationwide.    It was the most violent day of campus protests in the capital since...
lead_paragraph: Police fired tear gas at rock-throwing students on four Jakarta campuses today as tens of thousands of protesters held anti-Government rallies at universities nationwide. It was the most violent day of campus protests in the capital since Indonesia's economy plunged into crisis last year. At least four officers and seven students were injured.

headline: National News Briefs; Police Fire Gas at Crowd Protesting Alcohol Ban
snippet: Michigan State students clashed with police officers early today in a protest over a ban on alcohol at a popular site for tailgate parties.    Police officers fired tear gas into a crowd of students who converged on downtown shortly after midnight...
lead_paragraph: Michigan State students clashed with police officers early today in a protest over a ban on alcohol at a popular site for tailgate parties. Police officers fired tear gas into a crowd of students who converged on downtown shortly after midnight and lighted a bonfire. Students later set more bonfires, police said.

keywords: MEZA ROMERO, GLADYS; TORNAY, CEDRICH; POPE; ESTERMANN, ALOIS; VATICAN CITY; SWISS GUARDS; ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH; ASSASSINATIONS AND ATTEMPTED ASSASSINATIONS; MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; SUICIDES AND SUICIDE ATTEMPTS
headline: Chief Guard Is Killed in Vatican Along With Wife and a 2d Man
snippet: In a jarring clash of the sacred and profane, the commander of the Pope's Swiss Guards, his wife and another Swiss Guard were found shot to death in the Vatican on Monday night, just hours after he was appointed to the post.    A Vatican spokesman...
lead_paragraph: In a jarring clash of the sacred and profane, the commander of the Pope's Swiss Guards, his wife and another Swiss Guard were found shot to death in the Vatican on Monday night, just hours after he was appointed to the post. A Vatican spokesman confirmed after midnight that Col. Alois Estermann, 43, whom the Pope picked to lead the ancient, tradition-bound unit at midday, had been shot and killed along with his wife, Gladys Meza Romero, and Vice Cpl. Cedrich Tornay, in the commander's apartment in the Guards' barracks.

lead_paragraph: Police officers in riot gear used tear gas to disperse demonstrators who broke through a fence and tossed bottles and rocks in an effort to disrupt a Ku Klux Klan rally today. The authorities said five protesters were injured, none seriously.

headline: Pakistani Catholic Cleric Buried; Muslims Burn Christian Homes
snippet: Muslim militants burned homes and shops in a Christian neighborhood in this city in northeastern Pakistan today while 10,000 mourners buried a Roman Catholic bishop who committed suicide last week, apparently to protest religious discrimination.   ...
lead_paragraph: Muslim militants burned homes and shops in a Christian neighborhood in this city in northeastern Pakistan today while 10,000 mourners buried a Roman Catholic bishop who committed suicide last week, apparently to protest religious discrimination. Christian residents then attacked policemen for not responding quickly enough to the raid and riot policemen used tear gas to disperse the crowds, arresting 16 Muslim militants and 5 Christians. Three people were reported injured.

keywords: SUKARNO; INDONESIA; COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Protesters In Indonesia Find Allies In Parents
snippet: At 72, with a career as an army general and provincial governor behind him, G. P. Solichin is no revolutionary. But he believes that Indonesia desperately needs change.    So when his son, a 24-year-old accounting student in the western Java city of...
lead_paragraph: At 72, with a career as an army general and provincial governor behind him, G. P. Solichin is no revolutionary. But he believes that Indonesia desperately needs change. So when his son, a 24-year-old accounting student in the western Java city of Bandung, told his father that he had joined protests calling for the ouster of President Suharto, Lieutenant General Solichin supported him. And what about the risk of rubber bullets, truncheons and tear gas?

keywords: SUHARTO; JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; SUSPENSIONS, DISMISSALS AND RESIGNATIONS; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Indonesian Riot Police Open Fire At Protests, Killing Six Students
snippet: Security forces killed six  students and wounded at least a dozen others when they opened fire on a demonstration that had spilled from a college campus onto a major highway here on Tuesday, witnesses said.     According to several of the witnesses,...
lead_paragraph: Security forces killed six students and wounded at least a dozen others when they opened fire on a demonstration that had spilled from a college campus onto a major highway here on Tuesday, witnesses said. According to several of the witnesses, the violence started after a peaceful day of demonstrating by about 10,000 students, who sang songs and called for the resignation of President Suharto. But when they refused to return to campus, the police advanced on the students, clubbing them with truncheons and shooting into the crowd as students ran wildly toward the campus gates.

keywords: HABIBIE, B J; SUHARTO; EGYPT; JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; LOOT AND LOOTING; INDONESIA-INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS-EGYPT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS
headline: Riots Break Out in Jakarta After Shooting of Students
snippet: Riots exploded near the central business district of the Indonesian capital today as residents outraged over the police shootings of students on Tuesday tore down lampposts, set fire to trucks and looted stores.    At least one person was killed this...
lead_paragraph: Riots exploded near the central business district of the Indonesian capital today as residents outraged over the police shootings of students on Tuesday tore down lampposts, set fire to trucks and looted stores. At least one person was killed this afternoon, when a runaway truck plunged into a crowd. [Reuters reported that 12 people died in Jakarta, most of them burned to death in a bar set on fire by rioters.]

keywords: WEST BANK; ISRAEL; JERUSALEM; MIDDLE EAST; GAZA STRIP; PALESTINIANS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: 9 Palestinians Die in Protests Marking Israel's Anniversary
snippet: Palestinians today marked the 50th anniversary of the creation of Israel, an event they call the ''catastrophe,'' with two minutes of silence and several hours of violence during which Israeli forces fired on crowds and nine Palestinians were left...
lead_paragraph: Palestinians today marked the 50th anniversary of the creation of Israel, an event they call the ''catastrophe,'' with two minutes of silence and several hours of violence during which Israeli forces fired on crowds and nine Palestinians were left dead. It was the worst Arab-Israeli violence since September 1996.

keywords: CHILDERS, RICK; CARR, HANK; CROOKS, JAMES; BELL, RANDY; FLORIDA; ATTACKS ON POLICE; MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; SUICIDES AND SUICIDE ATTEMPTS; POLICE
headline: Man Found Dead After Killing 3 Officers and Taking Hostage
snippet: Two Tampa police officers and a Florida Highway Patrol officer were shot and killed today by a man who hours later was found dead, apparently from a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head.    The man, identified as Hank Carr, had held a clerk...
lead_paragraph: Two Tampa police officers and a Florida Highway Patrol officer were shot and killed today by a man who hours later was found dead, apparently from a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head. The man, identified as Hank Carr, had held a clerk hostage at a gas station in Brooksville, near Tampa, since about 4 P.M. before releasing her almost four hours later. Moments after she had been freed, the police, who by then numbered more than 150, shot tear gas in the station and detonated a grenade designed for disorientation. They stormed in to find Mr. Carr, 33, dead.

keywords: HABIBIE, B J; SUHARTO; INDONESIA; CABINETS AND SUB-CABINETS; ARMAMENT, DEFENSE AND MILITARY FORCES; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Gently, Indonesia's Military Ends Seizure of Parliament
snippet: Indonesia's army retook Parliament in an overnight raid by hundreds of soldiers, who pushed, prodded and cajoled more than 2,000 students to leave the complex they had occupied for five days.    There were no casualties reported in the carefully...
lead_paragraph: Indonesia's army retook Parliament in an overnight raid by hundreds of soldiers, who pushed, prodded and cajoled more than 2,000 students to leave the complex they had occupied for five days. There were no casualties reported in the carefully planned operation, which lasted less than three hours and demonstrated that Indonesia's new Government is moving rapidly to assert its control over this strife-torn country.

keywords: DEFENSE TECHNOLOGY CORP OF AMERICA; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TEAR GAS
headline: SUNDAY: May 24, 1998: Gear; Mayhem Is Our Business
snippet: Spring is a busy time at Defense Technology Corporation of America, a company that manufactures ''less lethal'' munitions, like tear gas, for use by police and the military. Every May, jittery law-enforcement officials call from N.B.A.-playoff...
lead_paragraph: Spring is a busy time at Defense Technology Corporation of America, a company that manufactures ''less lethal'' munitions, like tear gas, for use by police and the military. Every May, jittery law-enforcement officials call from N.B.A.-playoff cities, afraid their team will bring home the world championship and its attendant civil disorder. The answer from the Casper, Wyo., company? Relax. The proper crowd-control tools are just a phone call away. There's certainly a lot to choose from. For mob dispersal, Defense Technology offers its No. 4 Triple Charger Grenade, which splits into three sections that spew tear gas, or the No. 3032 Golden Eagle Pepper Fog Generator (pictured), which produces clouds of smoke. Rooftop rowdies pelting officers with rocks tend to scatter when the No. 15 RP Stinger Grenade comes their way. The company's biggest seller, the No. 23 BR Bean Bag Round, can be speedily delivered at 300 feet per second from a 12-gauge shotgun.

keywords: SOUTH KOREA; INTERNATIONAL MONETARY FUND; CONGLOMERATES; LABOR; STRIKES; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; LAYOFFS AND JOB REDUCTIONS; TEMPORARY EMPLOYMENT
headline: South Koreans Protest Spread Of Layoffs In I.M.F. Plan
snippet: Tens of thousands of workers walked off their jobs today and staged polite protests against layoffs and the increasing use of temporary workers.    At Seoul Station, the transportation hub, neat rows of workers wearing red headbands sang labor...
lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of workers walked off their jobs today and staged polite protests against layoffs and the increasing use of temporary workers. At Seoul Station, the transportation hub, neat rows of workers wearing red headbands sang labor anthems and raised their fists and chanted, ''Let's destroy restructuring! Let's fight to secure our jobs!''

keywords: CASTRO, FIDEL; BUNTING, DONALD; WHITMAN, CHRISTINE TODD; CLINTON, BILL; FOERSTER, WERNER; CHESIMARD, JOANNE D; BRADLEY BEACH (NJ); CUBA; BLACK LIBERATION ARMY; ROBBERIES AND THEFTS; EXTRADITION; ATTACKS ON POLICE; MURDERS AND ATTEMPTED MURDERS; BLACKS; PRISON ESCAPES
headline: Friend of Black Militant Fugitive Is Held After Siege in New Jersey
snippet: After a 23-hour siege punctuated  by police bursts of tear gas and water from high-pressure hoses, a robbery suspect once active in a black militant group surrendered yesterday afternoon and ended a standoff that shattered the calm of a New Jersey...
lead_paragraph: After a 23-hour siege punctuated by police bursts of tear gas and water from high-pressure hoses, a robbery suspect once active in a black militant group surrendered yesterday afternoon and ended a standoff that shattered the calm of a New Jersey town, the authorities said. The suspect, Donald Bunting, a 48-year-old ex-convict identified as a friend of the fugitive Joanne D. Chesimard, emerged from his barricaded apartment in Bradley Beach at 2 P.M., shortly after a state police negotiator told him surrender was his only option.

keywords: BASSON, WOUTER; SOUTH AFRICA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT
headline: In Support of Apartheid: Poison Whisky and Sterilization
snippet: Screwdrivers held tiny poison-filled cylinders, rings had spring-loaded compartments hiding deadly powders, vials of whisky were laced with the toxic herbicide paraquat, even peppermints were spiked with botulism.    During testimony this week before...
lead_paragraph: Screwdrivers held tiny poison-filled cylinders, rings had spring-loaded compartments hiding deadly powders, vials of whisky were laced with the toxic herbicide paraquat, even peppermints were spiked with botulism. During testimony this week before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission, a parade of witnesses has made clear that undetectable ways of murdering political opponents were a high priority of a chemical and biological campaign during the apartheid era.

keywords: ABIOLA, MOSHOOD K O; ABIOLA, DUPE; FAWEHINMI, GANI; NIGERIA; LAGOS (NIGERIA); POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; TEAR GAS
headline: Opposition Rally in Nigeria Is Answered With Tear Gas
snippet: In the first showdown between Nigeria's new military leadership and promoters of democracy, hundreds of protesters braved a powerful deployment of the police and soldiers in Lagos today to mount a demonstration at a downtown market.    After a...
lead_paragraph: In the first showdown between Nigeria's new military leadership and promoters of democracy, hundreds of protesters braved a powerful deployment of the police and soldiers in Lagos today to mount a demonstration at a downtown market. After a morning of wary quiet in which schools remained closed and few people ventured outside, chanting protesters suddenly turned out in the afternoon near the Yaba market, and witnesses said the security forces responded with tear gas and shots in the air.

keywords: ABUBAKAR, ABDULSALAM; FAWEHINMI, GANI; NIGERIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Nigerian Demonstrator Details Police Roundup of Opposition
snippet: A Nigerian opposition leader arrested during a demonstration on Friday, Chief Gani Fawehinmi, said today that he had been set free after being charged in connection with a protest against the new military ruler, Gen. Abdulsalam Abubakar.     ''I was...
lead_paragraph: A Nigerian opposition leader arrested during a demonstration on Friday, Chief Gani Fawehinmi, said today that he had been set free after being charged in connection with a protest against the new military ruler, Gen. Abdulsalam Abubakar. ''I was brutalized and taken into custody,'' the chief said. ''Then in the night we were taken to Magistrates' Court and charged with unlawful assembly, where we pleaded not guilty.'' He added that other political activists remained in custody.

headline: Ceremony Robs Players of Sleep
snippet: Much to the dismay of the coach, Iranian players gave up hours of needed sleep before their World Cup debut yesterday to participate in a long, late-night Islamic ceremony.    Held to mourn a seventh-century Shiite Muslim saint, the ceremony took...
lead_paragraph: Much to the dismay of the coach, Iranian players gave up hours of needed sleep before their World Cup debut yesterday to participate in a long, late-night Islamic ceremony. Held to mourn a seventh-century Shiite Muslim saint, the ceremony took place at the insistence of the Iranian Embassy in Paris, according to Iranian reporters.

keywords: GREAT BRITAIN; MARSEILLES (FRANCE); TUNISIA; WORLD CUP (SOCCER); SOCCER; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Fans Set Off Another Day of Violence
snippet: Hooliganism, soccer's recurring headache, turned Marseilles into a city of tear gas for the second consecutive day today as a World Cup game between England and Tunisia was overshadowed by clashes that took place outside the stadium.    French riot...
lead_paragraph: Hooliganism, soccer's recurring headache, turned Marseilles into a city of tear gas for the second consecutive day today as a World Cup game between England and Tunisia was overshadowed by clashes that took place outside the stadium. French riot police had to intervene again, this time to stop fighting between the two teams' fans that was taking place in the streets and on a beach. As of 9 P.M., 16 more people had been arrested and 22 treated at local hospitals, a spokesman for the regional prefecture said.

keywords: ISAACSON, WALTER; VAN BUSKIRK, ROBERT; OLIVER, APRIL; LAOS; TIME; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; TIME WARNER INC; BIOLOGICAL AND CHEMICAL WARFARE; VIETNAM WAR; SARIN (NERVE GAS); POISON GASES; DESERTION
headline: Time Orders Investigation On Accuracy Of CNN Report
snippet: Doubts raised about the accuracy of a recent article that was published in Time magazine but was written by Cable News Network journalists are serious enough that Time's editors have ordered a further investigation.    The article asserted that the...
lead_paragraph: Doubts raised about the accuracy of a recent article that was published in Time magazine but was written by Cable News Network journalists are serious enough that Time's editors have ordered a further investigation. The article asserted that the United States military dropped lethal nerve gas on a Laotian village in 1970, during the Vietnam war, as part of a secret mission to kill American defectors.

keywords: IRAQ; LAOS; TIME; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; UNITED NATIONS; BIOLOGICAL AND CHEMICAL WARFARE; VIETNAM WAR; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; POISON GASES; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: Essay; Some Nerve
snippet: Nothing is more criminal in war than the use of poison gas. Thus it was with some horror that we read and watched the accusation by Time magazine and CNN that the United States used poison gas -- sarin, a lethal nerve gas -- in a commando raid in...
lead_paragraph: Nothing is more criminal in war than the use of poison gas. Thus it was with some horror that we read and watched the accusation by Time magazine and CNN that the United States used poison gas -- sarin, a lethal nerve gas -- in a commando raid in Laos during the Vietnam War. Not since the K.G.B. disinformation department spread word that the U.S. was causing the AIDS epidemic in Africa has there been such a charge of American evildoing. This time it was Ted Turner's two responsible news organizations, citing 200 interviews during an eight-month investigation, reporting eyewitness accounts of the atrocity. Time wrote that Adm. Thomas Moorer, then Chairman of the Joint Chiefs, was ''confirming the use of sarin.''

keywords: GREAT BRITAIN; COLOMBIA; WORLD CUP (SOCCER); SOCCER
headline: England Qualifies For Round 2 With Flair
snippet: A revitalized England, inspired by the return of midfielder David Beckham, surged to a 2-0 victory today over Colombia and qualified for the second round of the World Cup tournament.    Colombia, with its aging team revolving around its captain,...
lead_paragraph: A revitalized England, inspired by the return of midfielder David Beckham, surged to a 2-0 victory today over Colombia and qualified for the second round of the World Cup tournament. Colombia, with its aging team revolving around its captain, Carlos Valderrama, could find little space for its close passing game and bowed tamely out of the tournament. But for the remarkable goalkeeping of Farid Mondragon, the defeat would have turned into a rout.

keywords: ZEDILLO, ERNESTO; CHIAPAS (MEX); EL BOSQUE (MEX); MEXICO; CIVIL WAR AND GUERRILLA WARFARE
headline: Mexico Squeezes Rebels, Provoking New Grief
snippet: The Mayor of this country town in the southern state of Chiapas should be a happy man. Instead he is in anguish.    On June 10 the state Governor ordered hundreds of police and army troops to storm El Bosque and recapture the town hall from...
lead_paragraph: The Mayor of this country town in the southern state of Chiapas should be a happy man. Instead he is in anguish. On June 10 the state Governor ordered hundreds of police and army troops to storm El Bosque and recapture the town hall from supporters of the Zapatista rebels, who seized it two years ago, ousted Mayor Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez and set up their own parallel administration. The troops arrested the self-appointed Zapatista officials and reinstated Mr. Gonzalez, who is from the Government's party.

keywords: VIETNAM WAR; POISON GASES; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: Ideas & Trends; Memories Of Wars Never Fought
snippet: A BLOCKBUSTER of a story launched a highly touted television program. But its central allegation was largely based on a disputed interviewing technique involving recovered memories that the American Psychiatric Association has condemned.    Recovered...
lead_paragraph: A BLOCKBUSTER of a story launched a highly touted television program. But its central allegation was largely based on a disputed interviewing technique involving recovered memories that the American Psychiatric Association has condemned. Recovered memories -- suppressed horrors dredged up under therapy -- drew attention a few years ago when they became the basis of a spate of charges of incest, satanic-ritual abuse and sexual abuse at child-care centers. They were discredited when investigators determined that many of them had been implanted by zealous therapists determined to find a cause for a patient's emotional distress.

keywords: NEWSSTAND: CNN AND TIME (TV PROGRAM); JOHNSON, TOM; ABRAMS, FLOYD; SMITH, JACK; ARNETT, PETER; HILL, PAMELA; OLIVER, APRIL; TIME; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; BIOLOGICAL AND CHEMICAL WARFARE; VIETNAM WAR; TELEVISION; SARIN (NERVE GAS); NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA
headline: CNN Retracts Report That U.S. Used Nerve Gas
snippet: Cable News Network executives yesterday retracted the network's report that the United States military used lethal sarin nerve gas in a secret 1970 mission in Laos with the intention of killing American defectors.    The retraction, broadcast...
lead_paragraph: Cable News Network executives yesterday retracted the network's report that the United States military used lethal sarin nerve gas in a secret 1970 mission in Laos with the intention of killing American defectors. The retraction, broadcast yesterday afternoon and accompanied by an apology, was based on an independent investigation, done at CNN's request, that showed the report's conclusions were not supported by the evidence.

keywords: ARNETT, PETER; OLIVER, APRIL; LAOS; TIME; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; SUSPENSIONS, DISMISSALS AND RESIGNATIONS; VIETNAM WAR; SARIN (NERVE GAS); POISON GASES; ETHICS; DESERTION; NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: Producer of Retracted CNN Report Defends Story, but Critics Fault Her Style
snippet: Ever since she entered the television news business in the mid-1980's, April Oliver has impressed her colleagues as an extremely confident and dedicated journalist. She gathered and synthesized details quickly. Her brisk, articulate presentations...
lead_paragraph: Ever since she entered the television news business in the mid-1980's, April Oliver has impressed her colleagues as an extremely confident and dedicated journalist. She gathered and synthesized details quickly. Her brisk, articulate presentations inspired trust. Now Ms. Oliver and her style are at the center of the latest in a series of news scandals -- CNN's retraction of its report that the United States used nerve gas in Laos in the Vietnam War as part of a secret mission to kill American defectors.

keywords: JOHNSON, TOM; ARNETT, PETER; LAOS; TIME; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; TIME-WARNER; BIOLOGICAL AND CHEMICAL WARFARE; VIETNAM WAR; SARIN (NERVE GAS); ETHICS; DESERTION; NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: CNN Employees Pointedly Ask How Managers Escaped Purge
snippet: Hundreds of angry Cable News Network staff members in the network's Atlanta headquarters and more calling in from CNN's bureaus around the world took part in two meetings at which some demanded to know why the network's top managers stayed on the job...
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of angry Cable News Network staff members in the network's Atlanta headquarters and more calling in from CNN's bureaus around the world took part in two meetings at which some demanded to know why the network's top managers stayed on the job after last week's apology and repudiation of its report that the American military had used nerve gas on a 1970 mission in Laos. Tom Johnson, the chairman of CNN News Group, told the group that his offer of resignation had twice been rejected by Gerald Levin, the chairman of Time Warner, the network's corporate parent, and Ted Turner, the founder of CNN and now vice chairman of Time Warner.

keywords: ARNETT, PETER; LAOS; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; VIETNAM WAR; SARIN (NERVE GAS); POISON GASES; NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: Career of a CNN Star Hangs in the Balance Over a Repudiated Report
snippet: No one man can make a network. But if it is possible for one man to give a network a recognizable face, Peter Arnett did that for Cable News Network when American bombs began to fall on Baghdad in 1991. It was his kind of story -- ''action'' is the...
lead_paragraph: No one man can make a network. But if it is possible for one man to give a network a recognizable face, Peter Arnett did that for Cable News Network when American bombs began to fall on Baghdad in 1991. It was his kind of story -- ''action'' is the word he comes back to, over and over, in describing what has been the signature of his career for 35 years. But it was not an action story that left Mr. Arnett's career in limbo and put him on a plane for Atlanta yesterday for a meeting with network executives today that could determine how long CNN's most famous face will remain with the network.

keywords: ARNETT, PETER; AMANPOUR, CHRISTIANE; LAOS; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; SUSPENSIONS, DISMISSALS AND RESIGNATIONS; VIETNAM WAR; SARIN (NERVE GAS); POISON GASES; ETHICS; NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA
headline: CNN Retains Arnett Despite Role in Flawed Nerve-Gas Report
snippet: Top executives of the Cable News Network said yesterday they would allow Peter Arnett to keep his job as a correspondent despite his participation in the network's repudiated report on the use of nerve gas on a secret 1970 mission in Laos.    ''Peter...
lead_paragraph: Top executives of the Cable News Network said yesterday they would allow Peter Arnett to keep his job as a correspondent despite his participation in the network's repudiated report on the use of nerve gas on a secret 1970 mission in Laos. ''Peter Arnett's reprimand stands,'' said a statement issued by Tom Johnson, the chairman and chief executive of CNN News Group. ''No further personnel actions are planned.''

keywords: SORRELL, MAURICE; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; DEATHS (OBITUARIES)
headline: Maurice Sorrell, 84, a News Photographer
snippet: Maurice Sorrell, a photographer who covered the height of the civil rights era in the South and became the first black member of the White House Photographers Association,  died on June 22 at Providence Hospital in Washington. He was 84 and lived in...
lead_paragraph: Maurice Sorrell, a photographer who covered the height of the civil rights era in the South and became the first black member of the White House Photographers Association, died on June 22 at Providence Hospital in Washington. He was 84 and lived in Washington. Mr. Sorrell was a news photographer in the Washington bureau of the Johnson Publishing Company, which publishes Jet and Ebony magazines, from 1962 until he retired in 1993. He photographed civil rights events during the 1960's despite ''dogs snipping at my heels, tear gas, bayonets at the back,'' he once recalled in an interview.

keywords: JONES, GAYL; HIGGINS, BOB; BLACKS; BOOKS AND LITERATURE; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; SUICIDES AND SUICIDE ATTEMPTS
headline: Chronicle of a Tragedy Foretold
snippet: On the evening of Feb. 20, 1998, less than a week after the much-heralded publication of her first novel in more than 20 years, Gayl Jones, 48, was handcuffed and removed from her Lexington, Ky., home by the local police. Inside the two-bedroom...
lead_paragraph: On the evening of Feb. 20, 1998, less than a week after the much-heralded publication of her first novel in more than 20 years, Gayl Jones, 48, was handcuffed and removed from her Lexington, Ky., home by the local police. Inside the two-bedroom bungalow, her husband lay bleeding from a self-inflicted knife wound. The confrontation began just after 6 P.M., when police officers knocked on the door at 440 Locust Avenue to serve a 15-year-old warrant for the arrest of Bob Higgins, also known as Bob Jones. The man opened the door a crack, but after a brief exchange with the cops, he slammed it shut, ran to the rear of the house and reappeared, holding two knives to his throat. ''Don't come in,'' he screamed. ''I'll kill myself if you come in here.''

keywords: COHEN, WILLIAM S; LAOS; TIME; CABLE NEWS NETWORK; BIOLOGICAL AND CHEMICAL WARFARE; VIETNAM WAR; SARIN (NERVE GAS); NEWS AND NEWS MEDIA; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: Pentagon Report Dismisses Nerve Gas Charge
snippet: With veterans of a once-secret mission by his side, Defense Secretary William S. Cohen issued a detailed Pentagon report today dismissing the accusation in a media report that United States forces involved in a 1970 operation in the Vietnam War used...
lead_paragraph: With veterans of a once-secret mission by his side, Defense Secretary William S. Cohen issued a detailed Pentagon report today dismissing the accusation in a media report that United States forces involved in a 1970 operation in the Vietnam War used nerve gas to kill American defectors. The Pentagon report on Operation Tailwind, a special-forces mission into Laos that was the subject of a CNN-Time magazine report in June, found that the operation was both a reconnaissance and diversionary mission to draw enemy forces away from a larger C.I.A.-backed operation to cut enemy lines of communication inside Laos.

headline: Liberties; An American Tragedy
snippet: When I was a teen-ager, in the 60's, I never told people that my father was a cop. It wasn't cool.    In the Vietnam era, with the National Guard killing kids at Kent State, with the Chicago police billyclubbing yippies, with the stench of tear gas...
lead_paragraph: When I was a teen-ager, in the 60's, I never told people that my father was a cop. It wasn't cool. In the Vietnam era, with the National Guard killing kids at Kent State, with the Chicago police billyclubbing yippies, with the stench of tear gas and class hatred everywhere, the last thing you wanted to do was admit you were related to someone in a uniform.

keywords: BRAZIL; TELEFONICA SA; MCI COMMUNICATIONS CORP; PORTUGAL TELECOM; TELECOMUNICACOES BRASILEIRAS SA; MERGERS, ACQUISITIONS AND DIVESTITURES; PRIVATIZATION; AUCTIONS; TELEPHONES AND TELECOMMUNICATIONS
headline: Brazil Sells Most of State Phone Utility
snippet: In the one of the largest privatization transactions ever, Brazil sold control of most of its telephone system yesterday for about $19 billion.    The auction of the 12 pieces of Telecomunicacoes Brasileiras S.A., known as Telebras, was dominated by...
lead_paragraph: In the one of the largest privatization transactions ever, Brazil sold control of most of its telephone system yesterday for about $19 billion. The auction of the 12 pieces of Telecomunicacoes Brasileiras S.A., known as Telebras, was dominated by Telefonica of Spain, Portugal Telecom and the MCI Communications Corporation -- partners in a loose global alliance that spent a total of $11.6 billion.

snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-9    A Global Search for Clues In Twin Terrorist Bombings  American intelligence officers and law-enforcement personnel from around the world streamed into Nairobi to search for clues in the bombing that killed at least 190 people...
lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-9 A Global Search for Clues In Twin Terrorist Bombings American intelligence officers and law-enforcement personnel from around the world streamed into Nairobi to search for clues in the bombing that killed at least 190 people and injured nearly 5,000 there. Officials said their investigation of the attacks on American embassies in Kenya and Tanzania was likely to reach across Africa and the Arabian peninsula to Afghanistan, looking into terrorist networks with bases in at least four countries. A1 The families of victims from Friday's bombing turned to the grim tasks of burying their dead and rebuilding their lives, as the death toll continued to rise. A1

headline: Street Violence Erupts During Nevada Festival
snippet: Police in riot gear used tear gas and dogs to subdue melees that erupted during the 11th annual Hot August Nights celebration here.    About 175,000 people were in Reno for the celebration, a five-day festival of classic automobiles and 1950's music....
lead_paragraph: Police in riot gear used tear gas and dogs to subdue melees that erupted during the 11th annual Hot August Nights celebration here. About 175,000 people were in Reno for the celebration, a five-day festival of classic automobiles and 1950's music. The disturbance erupted around 10:30 P.M. on Saturday, after the sanctioned events, officials said.

keywords: SUHARTO; INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Riot Erupts in Indonesia
snippet: Mobs burned buildings, stoned police cars and attacked ethnic Chinese in Indonesia today in the biggest riot since unrest in May helped oust Suharto from the presidency.     The violence in a northern province, Aceh, was touched off by bitterness...
lead_paragraph: Mobs burned buildings, stoned police cars and attacked ethnic Chinese in Indonesia today in the biggest riot since unrest in May helped oust Suharto from the presidency. The violence in a northern province, Aceh, was touched off by bitterness toward the military but ended up victimizing the Chinese. Soldiers fired tear gas. But the rioters burned a hotel, an office of the governing party and part of a shopping center. Many Chinese-owned stores were pelted with rocks.

headline: Police End Jakarta Protest With Bayonets
snippet: At least two Indonesian students were stabbed with bayonets and five were hospitalized after inhaling tear gas as security forces cleared Parliament of protesters today, news reports and witnesses said.    The official Antara news agency said two...
lead_paragraph: At least two Indonesian students were stabbed with bayonets and five were hospitalized after inhaling tear gas as security forces cleared Parliament of protesters today, news reports and witnesses said. The official Antara news agency said two students were hospitalized with bayonet wounds after a brief clash with troops.

snippet: The fury over Israel's slaying of two top Hamas fugitives led to a second day of clashes on the West Bank today, leaving at least 16 Palestinians and an Israeli soldier injured.    The Israeli military was on high alert and Palestinian lands remained...
lead_paragraph: The fury over Israel's slaying of two top Hamas fugitives led to a second day of clashes on the West Bank today, leaving at least 16 Palestinians and an Israeli soldier injured. The Israeli military was on high alert and Palestinian lands remained sealed off as the militant Islamic group Hamas threatened bomb attacks inside Israel in retaliation for the killings of the brothers, Imad and Adel Awadallah, who were wanted for a string of violent acts.

headline: Top Opposition Leader in Malaysia Is Jailed in Sex Case
snippet: After a day of lurid headlines and protests by thousands, the rising star of Malaysian politics, Anwar Ibrahim, was jailed tonight after a long, bitter struggle against his  one-time mentor, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad.    In the hours before his...
lead_paragraph: After a day of lurid headlines and protests by thousands, the rising star of Malaysian politics, Anwar Ibrahim, was jailed tonight after a long, bitter struggle against his one-time mentor, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad. In the hours before his arrest, apparently on charges of sexual indecency, Mr. Anwar led a mass rally calling for Dr. Mahathir's resignation, and the police fired tear gas at demonstrators who were marching on the Prime Minister's house.

keywords: MOHAMAD, MAHATHIR; IBRAHIM, ANWAR; MALAYSIA; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Malaysian Police Break Up Protests on Arrest
snippet: Acting to quell the biggest show of dissent faced by Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad in his 17 years in office, riot police officers fired tear gas and water cannons today to disperse thousands of people protesting the arrest of his former deputy.   ...
lead_paragraph: Acting to quell the biggest show of dissent faced by Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad in his 17 years in office, riot police officers fired tear gas and water cannons today to disperse thousands of people protesting the arrest of his former deputy. Federal police said the former deputy, Anwar Ibrahim, 51, who was arrested late Sunday, was being held under the Internal Security Act, which allows the indefinite imprisonment without charges or trial of people deemed to be a threat to national security.

keywords: MAHATHIR MOHAMAD; ANWAR IBRAHIM; MALAYSIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; HOMOSEXUALITY
headline: Using a Sexual Slur, Malaysian Calls Ex-Deputy Unacceptable
snippet: Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said today that he once had high hopes that his former deputy, Anwar Ibrahim, would be his successor. But he said that ''I cannot accept a man who is a sodomist as leader of the country.''    In his first public...
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said today that he once had high hopes that his former deputy, Anwar Ibrahim, would be his successor. But he said that ''I cannot accept a man who is a sodomist as leader of the country.'' In his first public statement about the arrest on Sunday of Mr. Anwar, the Prime Minister said he had interviewed men and women who said they had had illicit sex with Mr. Anwar.

keywords: IBRAHIM, ANWAR; KUALA LUMPUR (MALAYSIA); MALAYSIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Police in Malaysia Break Up a Protest
snippet: The police fired tear gas, beat demonstrators and used a water cannon today to break up a  protest by thousands of people in support of the ousted Deputy Prime Minister, Anwar Ibrahim.    Dozens were arrested for shouting slogans or waving posters in...
lead_paragraph: The police fired tear gas, beat demonstrators and used a water cannon today to break up a protest by thousands of people in support of the ousted Deputy Prime Minister, Anwar Ibrahim. Dozens were arrested for shouting slogans or waving posters in support of Mr. Anwar. The police kicked some of the protesters, while others were taken to police trucks and beaten, witnesses said.

keywords: ISRAEL; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Israeli Arabs And the Police Clash in North On Land Plan
snippet: In a disturbance reminiscent of scenes from the Palestinian uprising in the West Bank and Gaza, Israeli riot police officers clashed with Israeli Arabs in northern Israel today, wounding scores with tear gas and rubber-coated bullets as youths hurled...
lead_paragraph: In a disturbance reminiscent of scenes from the Palestinian uprising in the West Bank and Gaza, Israeli riot police officers clashed with Israeli Arabs in northern Israel today, wounding scores with tear gas and rubber-coated bullets as youths hurled rocks and set road blocks on fire. The melee was provoked by the Israeli Army's plan to confiscate acres of olive groves in the Israeli Arab town of Umm Al-Fahm and use the area for a firing range. Today, when the border police evicted protesters from a tent on the site, a call went out over mosque minarets for residents to defend their land.

keywords: WEIZMAN, EZER; ISRAEL; NAZARETH (ISRAEL); ARABS
headline: Israel's Arab Unrest Spreads to Nazareth
snippet: A surge of unrest among Arabs in Israel spread to Nazareth today after the apparent failure of an attempt by President Ezer Weizman of Israel to ease tensions.     Mr. Weizman visited the northern town of Umm al Fahm, where disturbances began on...
lead_paragraph: A surge of unrest among Arabs in Israel spread to Nazareth today after the apparent failure of an attempt by President Ezer Weizman of Israel to ease tensions. Mr. Weizman visited the northern town of Umm al Fahm, where disturbances began on Sunday over land confiscations for a military installation, but residents said clashes with security forces had continued into the night there for a third straight day.

lead_paragraph: A day after they sealed off the West Bank and Gaza, Israeli troops wounded two Palestinians today with rubber-coated bullets in clashes in Hebron, witnesses said. The center of Hebron has been under an Israeli curfew since Wednesday, when 13 Israeli soldiers and border police officers were wounded in a grenade attack by suspected Palestinian militants.

lead_paragraph: Among Asia's leaders, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad was notable as a man with a bold vision: a physical and social transformation that would push this nation into the forefront of world affairs. It almost came true.

headline: Man Kills Himself After 2 Children Are Shot
snippet: A man who used a wheelchair because of multiple sclerosis crawled into the apartment of a woman he had dated and shot and killed her 9-year-old son and wounded the boy's 14-year-old sister this morning, the police said here.    Following a 12-hour...
lead_paragraph: A man who used a wheelchair because of multiple sclerosis crawled into the apartment of a woman he had dated and shot and killed her 9-year-old son and wounded the boy's 14-year-old sister this morning, the police said here. Following a 12-hour standoff, in which officers negotiated to resolve what they thought was a hostage situation, the man shot and killed himself after officers tossed tear gas into his apartment, the police said.

keywords: BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA; GOTEBORG (SWEDEN); SWEDEN; DISCOTHEQUES; FIRES AND FIREMEN; IMMIGRATION AND REFUGEES
headline: Teen-Age Refugees From Violence Died in Swedish Disco
snippet: They were teen-agers whose parents had brought them here from homes torn by war or terror -- from Bosnia, Eritrea, Somalia and others -- and in their new country they formed new bonds, through school and music and parties.    About 65 of the young...
lead_paragraph: They were teen-agers whose parents had brought them here from homes torn by war or terror -- from Bosnia, Eritrea, Somalia and others -- and in their new country they formed new bonds, through school and music and parties. About 65 of the young people died and more than 190 were seriously injured late Thursday night when fire and smoke engulfed an overcrowded makeshift discotheque that had only one unlocked door.

keywords: KHAYAT, ROBERT C; UNIVERSITY OF MISSISSIPPI; BLACKS; FINANCES; COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: The Final Refrains of 'Dixie'
snippet: Not so long ago, it would have been considered an act of cultural treason: Allison Grisham, a white sorority sister at the University of Mississippi, stood onstage at Fulton Chapel and explained to a hushed crowd why it was so important for students...
lead_paragraph: Not so long ago, it would have been considered an act of cultural treason: Allison Grisham, a white sorority sister at the University of Mississippi, stood onstage at Fulton Chapel and explained to a hushed crowd why it was so important for students and alumni at football games to stop waving the Confederate battle flag and singing ''Dixie.'' Standing beside her good friend Jada Love, who is black, Ms. Grisham told a forum sponsored by President Clinton's advisory board on race that she understood that many students regarded the rituals as a demonstration of school spirit, inherited from red-sweatered parents on family pilgrimages to Oxford.

keywords: MOHAMAD, MAHATHIR; IBRAHIM, ANWAR; MALAYSIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Trial in Malaysia Provokes Political Crisis
snippet: Two trials are under way in this suddenly fractious Southeast Asian country.    One is in a drab Kuala Lumpur courtroom, where Malaysia's former Deputy Prime Minister, Anwar Ibrahim, is fighting charges of corruption and sex-related crimes. The other...
lead_paragraph: Two trials are under way in this suddenly fractious Southeast Asian country. One is in a drab Kuala Lumpur courtroom, where Malaysia's former Deputy Prime Minister, Anwar Ibrahim, is fighting charges of corruption and sex-related crimes. The other is on the streets outside, where students, taxi drivers and politicians are treating the case as a referendum on Mr. Anwar's former boss, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad.

keywords: INDONESIA; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Indonesia's Students: An Unrelenting Force for Change
snippet: In a last line of defense, riot police officers fired tear gas, water cannon and rubber bullets Thursday night to keep student demonstrators from invading the grounds of Parliament as they did six months ago when they helped force the ouster of...
lead_paragraph: In a last line of defense, riot police officers fired tear gas, water cannon and rubber bullets Thursday night to keep student demonstrators from invading the grounds of Parliament as they did six months ago when they helped force the ouster of President Suharto. One police officer was killed and scores of people were reported injured in confrontations around the city as columns of students dodged or bulled their way through police lines.

lead_paragraph: Chicago vs. Gun Makers The City of Chicago and Cook County filed a $433 million lawsuit against the gun industry, accusing its dealers in Chicago's suburbs of flooding the city with illegal guns. Page A18.

snippet: INTERNATIONAL  A3-14    U.S. Buildup Continues As Isolation of Iraq Grows  The United States continued to build up its forces for a possible attack on Iraq, which gave no indication that it was willing to back down and resume United Nations arms...
lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-14 U.S. Buildup Continues As Isolation of Iraq Grows The United States continued to build up its forces for a possible attack on Iraq, which gave no indication that it was willing to back down and resume United Nations arms inspections. And unlike previous confrontations with Saddam Hussein, this one saw no last-minute efforts to mediate with the Iraqis. A1

keywords: JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; ELECTIONS; FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS
headline: Student Protest in Indonesia Explodes in Violence, and 8 Are Killed
snippet: Students, thugs and soldiers fought pitched battles in the streets of Jakarta on Friday night, as Parliament adopted decrees intended to nudge this suffering nation toward a more democratic future. It was the worst violence since President Suharto...
lead_paragraph: Students, thugs and soldiers fought pitched battles in the streets of Jakarta on Friday night, as Parliament adopted decrees intended to nudge this suffering nation toward a more democratic future. It was the worst violence since President Suharto resigned last May. At least eight people were killed and scores were injured as well-ordered soldiers and riot police fired volley after volley above and directly into throngs of demonstrators and into the grounds of a university.

keywords: ALBRIGHT, MADELEINE K; WAN AZIZAH; ANWAR IBRAHIM; MALAYSIA; FAR EAST, SOUTH AND SOUTHEAST ASIA AND PACIFIC AREAS; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND TRENDS
headline: Albright Visits With Wife Of Dissident In Malaysia
snippet: Secretary of State Madeleine K. Albright met the wife of a jailed Malaysian political leader here today in a gesture of solidarity that angered her hosts and suggested that politics could swamp economics at a meeting of Asian and Pacific Rim...
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Madeleine K. Albright met the wife of a jailed Malaysian political leader here today in a gesture of solidarity that angered her hosts and suggested that politics could swamp economics at a meeting of Asian and Pacific Rim countries. Mrs. Albright talked briefly with Wan Azizah Wan Ismail, the wife of Anwar Ibrahim, the former Deputy Prime Minister of Malaysia, who was imprisoned in September and is on trial for corruption and sex-related charges.

keywords: WEST BANK; EFRAT (WEST BANK); ISRAEL; AL KHADR (WEST BANK); PALESTINIANS; ROADS AND TRAFFIC
headline: Scourge of the West Bank Arabs: Israeli Bulldozers
snippet: Uprooted fruit trees and flattened grapevines littered swaths of freshly bulldozed land today in this Palestinian village, where the Israeli Army has begun clearing the way for a road linking a Jewish settlement to a highway.    ''This is the peace...
lead_paragraph: Uprooted fruit trees and flattened grapevines littered swaths of freshly bulldozed land today in this Palestinian village, where the Israeli Army has begun clearing the way for a road linking a Jewish settlement to a highway. ''This is the peace of the bulldozers,'' Ali Musa, a villager, said as he surveyed his trampled vines in a terraced valley of fig, almond and olive trees. ''We're losing our land.''

keywords: JAKARTA (INDONESIA); INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: As Army Bows Its Head, Jakarta's Students Grieve
snippet: Jakarta belonged to the students today as traffic stopped and security forces fell back to allow two large processions to mourn 16 students killed by gunfire last week.    To the sad notes of an anthem called ''Falling Flowers,'' and in the shiver of...
lead_paragraph: Jakarta belonged to the students today as traffic stopped and security forces fell back to allow two large processions to mourn 16 students killed by gunfire last week. To the sad notes of an anthem called ''Falling Flowers,'' and in the shiver of a sudden evening breeze, members of one procession stepped through a line of stolid riot policemen to lay red paper flowers at the gates of the Parliament building.

keywords: HABIBIE, B J; SUHARTO; INDONESIA; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: New Suharto Inquiry Follows Protests
snippet: After days of student protests, Indonesia's President, B.J. Habibie, ordered a new corruption inquiry today into his predecessor, President Suharto.    The decision to appoint a commission to investigate Mr. Suharto's wealth came six months after Mr....
lead_paragraph: After days of student protests, Indonesia's President, B.J. Habibie, ordered a new corruption inquiry today into his predecessor, President Suharto. The decision to appoint a commission to investigate Mr. Suharto's wealth came six months after Mr. Habibie replaced Mr. Suharto as head of state following deadly riots and protests.

snippet: A gang fight between Muslims and Christian migrants erupted into fierce rioting today in this tense city. Officials reported that six people were killed and nearly a dozen churches burned or damaged.    [On Monday morgue officials said  rescuers had...
lead_paragraph: A gang fight between Muslims and Christian migrants erupted into fierce rioting today in this tense city. Officials reported that six people were killed and nearly a dozen churches burned or damaged. [On Monday morgue officials said rescuers had found seven more charred bodies from the ruins of a gambling hall set ablaze by anti-Christian rioters on Sunday, bringing the known death toll to 13, Reuters reported.]

keywords: NETANYAHU, BENJAMIN; WEST BANK; ISRAEL; JERUSALEM; PALESTINIANS
headline: New Violence Prompts Netanyahu Warning on Pullout
snippet: A Palestinian mob beat an Israeli soldier and seized his gun in the West Bank today, prompting a warning from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that he might halt further Israeli troop withdrawals in the West Bank under the new land-for-security...
lead_paragraph: A Palestinian mob beat an Israeli soldier and seized his gun in the West Bank today, prompting a warning from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that he might halt further Israeli troop withdrawals in the West Bank under the new land-for-security accord with the Palestinians. Violence also erupted in East Jerusalem after a Palestinian was killed by an assailant believed to be a Jewish serial stabber responsible for attacks on several Arabs in the last year.

keywords: CLINTON, BILL; NETANYAHU, BENJAMIN; WEST BANK; ISRAEL; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; PALESTINIANS; ISRAEL-INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS-US; POLITICS AND GOVERNMENT; ELECTIONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: NETANYAHU GAINS DELAY IN KEY VOTE ON REMOVING HIM
snippet: The Israelis called it Big Monday.    Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was almost toppled. In what was seen as the most critical day yet for his faltering Government, Israeli lawmakers postponed a vote, at the last minute, to take the first step...
lead_paragraph: The Israelis called it Big Monday. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was almost toppled. In what was seen as the most critical day yet for his faltering Government, Israeli lawmakers postponed a vote, at the last minute, to take the first step toward dissolving Parliament and calling new elections.

headline: Streetscapes / The Alameda, Broadway and 84th Street; A Stretch of Neighborhood Stores Turns Upscale
snippet: THERE are A-level retail tenants sprinkled up and down Broadway, but an unusual strategy by the owner of a 1915 apartment house at the northwest corner of 84th Street is creating a mini-stretch of Madison Avenue on what is otherwise just a...
lead_paragraph: THERE are A-level retail tenants sprinkled up and down Broadway, but an unusual strategy by the owner of a 1915 apartment house at the northwest corner of 84th Street is creating a mini-stretch of Madison Avenue on what is otherwise just a neighborhood street. After 1900, when developers first built tall buildings on upper Broadway, the wide, tree-shaded street was a residential address of some distinction. The buildings at first did not have stores on the ground floor -- retail tenants, no matter how swell, were considered improper in a respectable residential building.

lead_paragraph: Student demonstrators clashed with soldiers today in a burst of gunfire, stone-throwing and clouds of tear gas as President B. J. Habibie warned that continued protests could lead to ''the disintegration of the nation.'' Scores of students were treated at hospitals after about 4,000 demonstrators, some of them throwing gasoline bombs, challenged security forces guarding the Parliament building.

lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-25 Attack on Iraq Continues As Damage Is Assessed The Pentagon announced that American and British attack jets battered military, intelligence and communications targets across Iraq for a second day but carefully avoided hitting commercial facilities that might produce chemical and biological weapons. After the second round of attacks, more than 25 people have reportedly been killed. A1

keywords: CLINTON, BILL; WEST BANK; IRAQ; ISRAEL; GAZA STRIP; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; PALESTINIANS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Clinton's Ratings Take Dip in West Bank
snippet: When President Clinton came to town this week, Tanya Ghattas took her four children, gave them American flags and went out to greet the unusual visitor.    ''We waved to him, he smiled, and we were very happy,'' Mrs. Ghattas recalled. ''He was like...
lead_paragraph: When President Clinton came to town this week, Tanya Ghattas took her four children, gave them American flags and went out to greet the unusual visitor. ''We waved to him, he smiled, and we were very happy,'' Mrs. Ghattas recalled. ''He was like the Prince of Peace for us, and we hoped that he would help us and bring peace. Now we're disappointed, because he's hitting the Iraqi people. I don't love Saddam Hussein, but I support the Iraqi people.''

keywords: SOUTH KOREA; SEOUL (SOUTH KOREA); APPOINTMENTS AND EXECUTIVE CHANGES; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; BUDDHISM
headline: Police Oust Feuding Monks at Seoul Temple
snippet: About 4,500 riot police officers stormed a Buddhist temple here today to end a drawn-out dispute among monks, provoking a vicious battle that left dozens injured, some seriously, witnesses said.    As several monks threatened to set themselves on...
lead_paragraph: About 4,500 riot police officers stormed a Buddhist temple here today to end a drawn-out dispute among monks, provoking a vicious battle that left dozens injured, some seriously, witnesses said. As several monks threatened to set themselves on fire or slit their stomachs, police officers brandishing batons moved in to Chogye Temple firing teargas grenades.

keywords: ASSAD, HAFEZ AL-; IRAQ; SYRIA; UNITED STATES FOREIGN SERVICE; UNITED STATES INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; SYRIA-INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS-US; UNITED STATES ARMAMENT AND DEFENSE
headline: Essay; Assad's Attack
snippet: Not since the takeover of the U.S. Embassy in Teheran has American territory been so egregiously invaded as last week -- and nobody in the distracted Clinton Administration seems to care.    In Damascus, where the Syrian dictator Hafez al-Assad...
lead_paragraph: Not since the takeover of the U.S. Embassy in Teheran has American territory been so egregiously invaded as last week -- and nobody in the distracted Clinton Administration seems to care. In Damascus, where the Syrian dictator Hafez al-Assad rigidly controls the populace, tens of thousands massed in protest, ostensibly about our bombing of Iraq. A selected part of the mob -- about 1,000 drawn from the ruling Baath Party -- was permitted to march at night where demonstrators are never allowed to go: through the upscale al-Rawdha neighborhood, where the United States Embassy and the Ambassador's residence are located.

keywords: RENO, JANET; ROOSEVELT, FRANKLIN DELANO; CUMMINGS, HOMER S; JUSTICE DEPARTMENT; RECORDS AND ACHIEVEMENTS; BIOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION
headline: Reno's Tenure Sets a Record This Century
snippet: Attorney General Janet Reno is set on Monday to become the longest-serving Attorney General of this century, surpassing the record set 60 years ago by Homer S. Cummings, an Attorney General in the Administration of Franklin Delano Roosevelt.    Ms....
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Janet Reno is set on Monday to become the longest-serving Attorney General of this century, surpassing the record set 60 years ago by Homer S. Cummings, an Attorney General in the Administration of Franklin Delano Roosevelt. Ms. Reno's longevity at the Justice Department is notable because she got the job in March 1993 almost by accident when President Clinton hurriedly plucked her from her job as the elected prosecutor for Dade County, in Florida, after his first two nominations for Attorney General collapsed in embarrassing controversies over household workers.

keywords: HUNAN PROVINCE (CHINA); CHINA; AGRICULTURE; LABOR; TAXATION; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: Thousands of Farmers Protest in China; 1 Dies in Police Clash
snippet: Thousands of farmers demonstrating against local officials clashed with hundreds of police officers in a small town in southern China last week, the latest and perhaps largest in a series of farmer and worker protests that have sprung up around China...
lead_paragraph: Thousands of farmers demonstrating against local officials clashed with hundreds of police officers in a small town in southern China last week, the latest and perhaps largest in a series of farmer and worker protests that have sprung up around China in the last year. The main battle, on Jan. 8 in Hunan Province, left one farmer dead and dozens injured after the police tried to disperse the crowd with clubs and tear gas, said the Information Center of Human Rights and Democratic Movement in China, a human rights group in Hong Kong. The account was independently confirmed by local witnesses.

keywords: KING, MARTIN LUTHER JR; NEW YORK CITY
headline: A Day of Tributes to a Dream That Still Inspires
snippet: Ronald Glenn, a history teacher at John Jay High School in Park Slope, Brooklyn, says he still treasures a photograph of himself at 14 with the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Mr. Glenn was the editor of his school newspaper at the time.    ''My...
lead_paragraph: Ronald Glenn, a history teacher at John Jay High School in Park Slope, Brooklyn, says he still treasures a photograph of himself at 14 with the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Mr. Glenn was the editor of his school newspaper at the time. ''My family was the first black family to live in our neighborhood in East St. Louis,'' he said. ''My father took us to a cafeteria that wouldn't serve us, but we didn't leave until the cops came.''

keywords: VASILE, RADU; ROMANIA; BUCHAREST (ROMANIA); TARGU JIU (ROMANIA); LABOR; MINES AND MINING; WAGES AND SALARIES; COAL; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; LAYOFFS AND JOB REDUCTIONS

snippet: Thousands of striking miners climbed over barricades and clashed with the police today as they marched toward the capital to protest low wages and possible layoffs. At least 15 people were reported injured.    The police sprayed tear gas and threw...
lead_paragraph: Thousands of striking miners climbed over barricades and clashed with the police today as they marched toward the capital to protest low wages and possible layoffs. At least 15 people were reported injured. The police sprayed tear gas and threw smoke bombs to try to stop the estimated 10,000 miners as they moved south through the Jiu Valley toward Bucharest.

lead_paragraph: Striking Romanian coal miners stormed through police lines today, attacking riot officers with clubs and homemade explosives. Dozens of police officers were taken hostage as the miners refused to stop their march on the capital. At least 130 people were wounded and up to 50 police officers kidnapped in the assault as 7,000 miners overran Government roadblocks near this town on a central highway leading to Bucharest.

snippet: Two revenge attacks  including one in broad daylight in the center of the town on a visiting Government delegation -- shook this small, rural town today in the wake of the assassination of a prominent local politician on Saturday.     The police said...
lead_paragraph: Two revenge attacks including one in broad daylight in the center of the town on a visiting Government delegation -- shook this small, rural town today in the wake of the assassination of a prominent local politician on Saturday. The police said afterward that they were stunned by the boldness of the two attacks, which left 11 people dead and took place while dozens of armored police and army vehicles were patrolling the area.

headline: World Briefing
snippet: EUROPE    UKRAINE: LARGE NUCLEAR DUMP PLANNED -- Europe's largest radioactive dump, with a capacity of 650 tons of waste, is to open next year at the Zaporizhye plant in southern Ukraine. Most of the nuclear waste produced at the plant had been...
lead_paragraph: EUROPE UKRAINE: LARGE NUCLEAR DUMP PLANNED -- Europe's largest radioactive dump, with a capacity of 650 tons of waste, is to open next year at the Zaporizhye plant in southern Ukraine. Most of the nuclear waste produced at the plant had been shipped to Krasnoyarsk, in Siberia. But authorities there said last November that they would no longer acccept the waste because Ukraine did not pay enough. (Agence France-Presse)

keywords: HUNAN PROVINCE (CHINA); CHINA; YIZHANG (CHINA); BOMBS AND EXPLOSIVES; ETHICS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS
headline: 8 Killed in Explosion in China; Bomb Is Suspected
snippet: An explosion on Monday in a county seat in southeastern China killed at least 8 people and injured more than 60, according to local officials.     The cause of the blast has not been determined, officials say, but a local journalist said there is...
lead_paragraph: An explosion on Monday in a county seat in southeastern China killed at least 8 people and injured more than 60, according to local officials. The cause of the blast has not been determined, officials say, but a local journalist said there is evidence that it was intentional, and one doctor said victims had nails in their wounds. There has been no announcement of a suspect or a motive.

keywords: PASTRANA, ANDRES; ARMENIA (COLOMBIA); COLOMBIA; RESCUES; EARTHQUAKES
headline: 3 Days After Quake in Colombia, a Tapping in the Rubble Tells of Life
snippet: The Andalucia Apartments collapsed when the first powerful tremor hit here on Monday afternoon. But under tons of rubble where the five-story building once stood, someone was still alive today.     ''The rescue dogs smelled somebody there, and when...
lead_paragraph: The Andalucia Apartments collapsed when the first powerful tremor hit here on Monday afternoon. But under tons of rubble where the five-story building once stood, someone was still alive today. ''The rescue dogs smelled somebody there, and when we banged on the concrete that's in the way, whoever it is tapped back,'' said Nelson Bravo, a fireman who was part of a 30-member team searching for survivors of the earthquake that killed at least 883 people in western Colombia and left more than 3,000 injured. ''We can't tell if it's a man or a woman, but now we have to get this person out before it's too late.''

keywords: ARMENIA (COLOMBIA); COLOMBIA; EARTHQUAKES; LOOTING
headline: Colombia Sends Troops to Quake Zone to Control Looters
snippet: Army and police units clashed repeatedly with roving bands of looters in the heart of this ravaged city today, slowing the delivery of supplies to thousands of residents left homeless by the earthquake on Monday.    The gangs, composed primarily of...
lead_paragraph: Army and police units clashed repeatedly with roving bands of looters in the heart of this ravaged city today, slowing the delivery of supplies to thousands of residents left homeless by the earthquake on Monday. The gangs, composed primarily of young men, struck early and often, until the authorities were able to restore order early this afternoon through a show of force and numerous arrests.

keywords: DENVER (COLO); DENVER BRONCOS; ATLANTA FALCONS; DEMONSTRATIONS AND RIOTS; SUPER BOWL; FOOTBALL; TEAR GAS
headline: Tear Gas Used on Denver Crowd
snippet: The police used tear gas tonight to disperse crowds downtown here after Broncos fans spilled into the streets to celebrate a second straight Super Bowl victory, this one a 34-19 thrashing of the Atlanta Falcons.    In lower downtown, bars emptied as...
lead_paragraph: The police used tear gas tonight to disperse crowds downtown here after Broncos fans spilled into the streets to celebrate a second straight Super Bowl victory, this one a 34-19 thrashing of the Atlanta Falcons. In lower downtown, bars emptied as the game ended and fans started bonfires and set off firecrackers in Larimer Square. When the estimated crowd of 1,000 would not disperse, police officers threw tear gas canisters and marched down Larimer Street in riot gear, pounding their shields with their clubs.
